0.title: Man rips up road reportedly built for ₹3.8 crore with hands in UP; video surfaces
0.article_body: A video of a man ripping up a road, reportedly built for ₹3.8 crore, using his hands in Uttar Pradesh's Pilibhit has surfaced online. In the purported video, the man can be heard asking authorities to take action against the contractor. An assistant engineer at Rural Engineering Department said that administrative officials had got the road repaired, Times Now reported.

1.title: Sajid kept looking at my private parts, said I should use oil for breasts: Sheela Seth
1.article_body: Actress Sheela Priya Seth has accused filmmaker Sajid Khan of looking at her private parts for about five minutes straight in 2008. Sheela stated, "Sajid said I should get surgery done as my breasts aren't big enough for Bollywood. He even said I should use some oils to enlarge my breasts." "These remarks of Sajid Khan terrified me," Sheela said.

2.title: College girl dies after being raped in UP, 25-yr-old accused says he took 'energy pill'
2.article_body: A 25-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly raping a college student who died due to excessive bleeding in Uttar Pradesh's Unnao. Police said that accused confessed to the crime and claimed to have taken an energy enhancing pill before committing the crime. The victim's father alleged that a 28-year-old neighbour and a 65-year-old woman were involved in the incident.

3.title: Aftab bought fridge to store girlfriend Shraddha's body parts for days in Delhi: Police
3.article_body: After a man named Aftab Ameen was arrested for allegedly killing and chopping his 26-year-old live-in partner Shraddha into 35 pieces in Delhi, police said that he had bought a fridge to store her parts before disposing them. Aftab, who allegedly killed her on May 18, threw her body parts across the city over the next 18 days.

4.title: Earthquake of 6.1 magnitude hits Japan, tremors felt in Tokyo
4.article_body: An earthquake of magnitude 6.1 was detected off central Japan on Monday and the tremors were felt in Tokyo and other cities. As per the USGS, the earthquake hit 84 km South Southeast of Toba in Japan around 1:38 pm UTC. It had a depth of 357 km, the agency added. No warning for a tsunami was issued immediately.

5.title: Rajkummar reveals he was supposed to be one of the leads in 'Gangs...'
5.article_body: Rajkummar Rao shared that when he was initially offered Anurag Kashyap's 'Gangs of Wasseypur', he was one of the leads in the film. "The film he (Anurag) narrated was Faisal Khan (Nawazuddin's role) vs Shamshad Alam (Rajkummar's role)," he revealed. Rajkummar added that after Anurag finished writing the film's script, he told him that his role "had become much shorter".

6.title: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal knew about Jal Board scam: BJP
6.article_body: The BJP demanded an FIR against Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal in the alleged ₹20 crore Delhi Jal Board scam and claimed that Kejriwal knew about the irregularities. "When Kejriwal got to know about this, he did not file an FIR...instead, he extended the contract with Corporation Bank for two more years and also increased their commission," said the BJP.

7.title: Illegal structures of accused in MLAs poaching case demolished in Hyd
7.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) on Sunday demolished two structures, which it deemed illegal, being taken up inside a restaurant in the city. The alleged illegal structures are linked to Nanda Kumar, who was earlier arrested in the TRS MLAs poaching case. A senior GHMC official claimed Kumar didn't pay attention to notices seeking to stop construction.

8.title: I will expose the reality of how Pakistan treated me, it will shock many: Adnan Sami
8.article_body: Singer Adnan Sami, who was a Pakistani citizen, said he has "major issues" with the Pakistan establishment. "One day...I'll expose the reality of how they treated me...which not many know...least of all the general public," he said, adding that it'll shock many. Adnan stated what the establishment did to him was one of the big reasons why he left Pakistan.

9.title: Player of T20 World Cup 2022 Sam Curran was commentator in T20 World Cup 2021
9.article_body: England all-rounder Sam Curran, who won Player of the Tournament award for taking 13 wickets in T20 World Cup 2022, worked as a commentator in T20 World Cup 2021 while recovering from a back injury. The 24-year-old had sustained the injury during IPL 2021. Curran was the only bowler to take a five-wicket haul in T20 World Cup 2022.

10.title: The maker of modern India: Kharge on Jawaharlal Nehru's birth anniversary
10.article_body: On the occasion of former PM Jawaharlal Nehru’s birth anniversary, Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge said his progressive thoughts furthered India’s social, political and economic development, despite challenges. “Pandit Nehru - the maker of modern India. The 21st century India cannot be imagined without his tremendous contribution,” Kharge tweeted. “My humble homage to a true patriot,” he added.

11.title: Will highlight our commitment towards global challenges: PM ahead of G20
11.article_body: Ahead of the G20 summit in Indonesia, PM Narendra Modi said that he will highlight India's achievements and unwavering commitment to collectively address global challenges. "India will officially assume the G20 Presidency from 1st December 2022. I will also extend my personal invitation to G20 members and other invitees to our G20 summit next year," said PM Modi.

12.title: Mahesh Babu's father Krishna suffers cardiac arrest, admitted in ICU in Hyderabad
12.article_body: Actor Mahesh Babu's father Krishna was rushed to a hospital in Hyderabad last night in an unconscious state after suffering a cardiac arrest. As per a hospital report, he was revived after performing CPR and is currently in ICU, where he will be monitored for next 24 hours. Krishna's first wife and Mahesh Babu's mother Indira Devi died in September.

13.title: Adani replies to tweet on help for 4-yr-old with hole in heart, says 'she'll be fine soon'
13.article_body: Gautam Adani has replied to a tweet seeking help for a four-year-old girl named Manushree who has a hole in her heart. The post sought ₹1.25 lakh for her treatment. "Manushree will be fine very soon. Have asked [Adani Foundation] to...ensure that the family gets all possible help...to get Manushree back to school playing with her friends," Adani tweeted.

14.title: Faridabad Police launch night pick-and-drop facility for women
14.article_body: Faridabad Police have launched a free night pick-and-drop facility for women. The initiative was taken to ensure the safety of women and curb crimes against them at night, police said. "Any woman who is not able...to get back home between 10 pm and 6 am can call the police helpline numbers, [which are] 9999150000, 0129-2227200 and 7290010000," an official said.

15.title: If I were running Indian cricket, I'd look at England for inspiration: Vaughan
15.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan has said their current men's cricket team is a "trendsetting team" and the rest of the world should emulate them. "If I [were] running Indian cricket, I'd swallow my pride and look at England for inspiration," he added. England have become the first-ever team to hold both ODI and T20 World Cups at the same time.

16.title: Harry Styles does gender reveal for pregnant fan at concert, fans react
16.article_body: Singer-actor Harry Styles, at his Los Angeles concert, revealed the gender of a pregnant fan's baby. The video of the moment has gone viral on social media platforms and has been receiving reactions from fans. "I'm voting for Harry Styles for Artist of The Year at the AMAs," a fan wrote, while another fan called the moment "really cute".

17.title: Kandhal Jadeja who is NCP's only MLA in Gujarat resigns from party
17.article_body: The only MLA for NCP in Gujarat Assembly, Kandhal Jadeja, has resigned from the party ahead of upcoming state Assembly elections. State NCP chief Jayant Boskey said that Jadeja, who is a two-time MLA from Kutiyana, has cited being denied a ticket as a reason for the resignation. Jadeja had filed his nomination for the upcoming polls under NCP earlier.

18.title: Pune Police arrest domestic help for theft of valuables worth ₹22.80 lakh
18.article_body: The Pune Police arrested a 34-year-old domestic help for stealing valuables worth ₹22.80 lakh from the house of his employer. According to the police, the accused took the help of others to commit the crime because he wanted to open a paper plate manufacturing unit. The stolen valuables have been recovered from the accused.

19.title: Twitter fires 4,400 contractual employees: Report
19.article_body: Elon Musk-led Twitter laid off 4,400 of its nearly 5,500 contractual employees in the US, India and other markets, Platformer reported. The contractual workers were laid off with no notice and they began losing access to Slack and email. This comes after Twitter already sacked nearly 50% of its overall staff and close to 90% of its India team.

20.title: Govt seeks time to reply on pleas challenging Places Of Worship Act
20.article_body: The Centre has sought more time from SC to submit its response to petitions challenging the constitutional validity of the Places of Worship Act. SC asked the Centre to file a response by December 12. The Act prohibits the filing of a lawsuit to reclaim a place of worship or change its character from what existed on August 15, 1947.

21.title: My Facebook page has been hacked, trying to restore it: Karthi
21.article_body: Actor Karthi shared on Twitter that his Facebook page was hacked and his team is trying to restore it. "Hello guys, my Facebook page has been hacked. We are trying to restore it with FB team," he tweeted. The tweet also received reactions from his fans. On the work front, Karthi was seen in 'Ponniyin Selvan: Part I' and 'Sardar'.

22.title: Vir Das' Hyderabad show cancelled amid protests, 2nd show cancelled in a week
22.article_body: Comedian Vir Das' stand-up show scheduled on November 20 in Hyderabad has been cancelled amid protests by right-wing organisations, who accused him of making 'anti-India' comments. Das' event in Bengaluru was also cancelled last week after threats of protests by Hindu Janajagruti Samiti (HJS), a right-wing organisation. "Das should apologise for his statement made against India in US," HJS said.

23.title: Gurugram man cheated of ₹45 lakh by 'South Korean woman' in crypto scam
23.article_body: A Gurugram-based businessman was allegedly cheated of ₹45 lakh by a woman, who claimed to be from South Korea, on the pretext of trading in cryptocurrency, police said. The man came in contact with the woman on Telegram and invested over ₹45 lakh on cryptocurrency exchange platform on her advice. He was later unable to withdraw money from the platform.

24.title: Politician gets 50 yrs' jail for killing husband with kids' help in Brazil
24.article_body: Former Brazilian Congresswoman Flordelis dos Santos was sentenced to 50 years in prison for her husband Anderson do Carmo's murder in 2019. She was accused of planning the murder, involving several of her grown children in the crime and staging it as robbery. Prosecutors claimed she wanted control over the couple's finances. The couple had adopted several street children.

25.title: Babar was pretty ordinary vs England, a captain can't bat like that: Harbhajan
25.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Harbhajan Singh has said Pakistan captain Babar Azam was pretty ordinary in his 32-run innings in the T20 World Cup final against England. "You're the captain of the ship and you cannot bat like that. You're putting your team in deep deep trouble," stated Harbhajan. England restricted Pakistan to 137/8 and chased down the target in 19 overs.

26.title: UFC star Anthony's 'Never been this afraid' note resurfaces after he dies aged 38
26.article_body: After two-time UFC title challenger Anthony 'Rumble' Johnson passed away aged 38, his old social media post on his illness has resurfaced online. In a note he posted last year, Anthony wrote, "Really wish I could go into detail about how ill I truly am...Never been this afraid of anything in my life."

27.title: Debina Bonnerjee shares video of premature daughter inside incubator, calls her 'miracle'
27.article_body: Actress Debina Bonnerjee on Sunday shared a video of her premature daughter inside an incubator being examined by doctors in a hospital on Instagram. Bonnerjee called her daughter a "miracle baby" and informed that she is doing fine, thanking the doctors. Bonnerjee and her husband actor Gurmeet Choudhary announced the birth of their second daughter on November 11.

28.title: Lingayat seer made minor sit on his lap, raped her several times: Police
28.article_body: Lingayat seer Shivamurthy Murugha Sharanaru, who is accused of sexually assaulting minor girls, used to call one victim to his room at night. He raped her multiple times from 2013-2015, police's chargesheet claimed. "He would make me sit on his lap and touch my private parts inappropriately and then have sex with me," the victim said, according to the chargesheet.

29.title: Village head assaults Dalit man in presence of police in UP; held
29.article_body: A village head was arrested after he, his wife and associates allegedly assaulted a 25-year-old Dalit man in the presence of police personnel in Uttar Pradesh's Baghpat. The man was assaulted while police were questioning him regarding a complaint that he was creating a nuisance and misbehaving with locals while under the influence of alcohol, the SHO said.

30.title: 'Yashoda' earns ₹20 cr worldwide, Samantha calls it 'best weekend ever'
30.article_body: The makers of 'Yashoda' shared that the film has earned ₹20 crore worldwide in its first weekend. Sharing the news on her Instagram Stories, actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu wrote that it has been the "best weekend ever". 'Yashoda', which released on November 11, marks Samantha's first film after she opened up about her myositis diagnosis.

31.title: Kerala HC cancels appointment of university VC whom Guv had asked to step down
31.article_body: Kerala High Court on Monday cancelled the appointment of Dr K Riji John as the Vice-Chancellor (VC) of the Kerala University of Fisheries and Ocean Studies. John is one of the VCs whom state Governor Arif Mohammed Khan had asked to step down in October. The court also ordered the formation of a search-cum-selection committee according to UGC norms.

32.title: Mumbai man gets bail after he assures court to care for minor girlfriend & baby
32.article_body: A 20-year-old Mumbai man, arrested for impregnating his minor girlfriend, was granted bail by a sessions court after he and his father assured the court that they will look after the minor and the newborn. A case was registered against the man, based on complaint filed by minor girl, who delivered a baby boy after her relationship with the accused.

33.title: Dalit man tied to pole, thrashed by upper-caste men in K'taka; 15 arrested
33.article_body: The Karnataka Police arrested 15 people for allegedly assaulting a Dalit man, Sagar, during an annual fair in Vijayapura district. According to the police, Sagar was drunk when a scuffle broke out after he questioned the upper-caste men for stopping the music during the festival. The men then tied him to a pole and thrashed him.

34.title: India's wholesale inflation dips to 8.39% in October, lowest since March 2021
34.article_body: India's wholesale inflation eased to 8.39% in October 2022 from 10.70% in September, data released by the Ministry of Commerce and Industry showed. The wholesale inflation index (WPI) has been in double digits for 18 consecutive months from April 2021 till September 2022. It stood at 7.89% in March 2021.

35.title: India reports 547 new COVID-19 cases, lowest since April 2020
35.article_body: India reported 547 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, the lowest since April 2020. The count of active cases has fallen below 10,000 for the first time since April 2020, at 9,468. According to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, the death toll in the country so far has reached 5,30,532.

36.title: I have too much work on my plate that is for sure: Elon Musk
36.article_body: Tesla, SpaceX and Twitter CEO Elon Musk at a business conference on the sidelines of the G20 summit said, "I have too much work on my plate that is for sure." Discussing his recent $44 billion acquisition of Twitter and heading Tesla, Musk said he was working "at the absolute most amount...from morning till night, seven days a week".

37.title: Man chops live-in partner into 35 parts, disposes them across Delhi for 18 days at 2am
37.article_body: A man has been arrested in Delhi for allegedly murdering his 26-year-old live-in partner and chopping her body into 35 pieces. Police said Aftab Ameen killed Shraddha on May 18 after she started forcing him for marriage. He allegedly left his home at 2am over the next 18 days to dispose of her body parts at different locations in Delhi.

38.title: 65-yr-old woman falls while 2 persons try to snatch her bag in Mumbai, dies
38.article_body: A 65-year-old homeless woman, sleeping on a cement platform in Mumbai, died after falling down three feet when two persons, including a 15-year-old boy, allegedly tried to snatch her bag in a robbery bid. The bag got stuck in her neck, throwing her off the platform. She was declared dead on arrival at a hospital due to head injuries.

39.title: Maha man who killed daughter, staged it as suicide was inspired by 'CID'
39.article_body: A man in Nagpur, Guddu Chhotelal Rajak, who allegedly killed his daughter and staged it as a suicide, was inspired by the crime series CID, police said. He wanted to teach his relatives and his wife a lesson after she refused to come back. A photograph showing the deceased with a noose around her neck was found on his phone.

40.title: Ranveer's '83' to screen in sign language, actor lends support
40.article_body: Director Kabir Khan's directorial '83' is set to screen in sign language. Sharing his reaction, Ranveer Singh said that he hopes the screening triggers more conversations related to making sign language the 23rd official language of India. "I've tried to do my bit...I'm always looking for opportunities to open up a conversation about the deaf people in India," he said.

41.title: UPSRTC introduces electronic ticketing to get real-time data
41.article_body: Uttar Pradesh State Road Transport Corporation (UPSRTC) is using android-based electronic ticketing machines to receive real-time data about its passengers and buses, according to a government spokesperson. UPSRTC Managing Director Sanjay Kumar said that the step, which allows the corporation to receive updated data of its buses, will be instrumental in providing services through digital means.

42.title: Varun Dhawan jumps off stage to help girl who fainted amid movie promotion in Jaipur
42.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan on Sunday jumped to the rescue of a girl who fainted during the promotional event of his upcoming film 'Bhediya' in Jaipur. A video of the incident has gone viral, in which Varun can be seen sitting by her side and making her drink water. Kriti Sanon is also seen asking the management to help the girl.

43.title: Punjab mandates use of paddy straw as 20% of fuel for brick kilns
43.article_body: The Punjab government on Sunday made it mandatory for brick kilns to use paddy straw as 20% of their fuel. The move will boost straw management and farmers will benefit financially by selling straw, state minister Gurmeet Singh Meet Hayer said. He added that industries are being encouraged to use stubble as fuel for ex-situ stubble management.

44.title: Maha govt committed to resolving traffic woes in Thane: CM Eknath Shinde
44.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde said his government is committed to resolving the traffic problems in Thane city. In order to eliminate traffic congestion in the city, various projects, including a bypass and extension of Eastern Freeway, have been undertaken, he added. The MMRDA and the Thane Municipal Corporation (TMC) are working with this goal, he said.

45.title: HMDA announces draw of lots for Rajiv Swagruha flats on Tuesday
45.article_body: The draw of lots for sale of Rajiv Swagruha flats will be done on November 15 for applicants who have paid the advance amounts, Hyderabad Metropolitan Development Authority (HMDA) announced. The draw for allotment of flats will be conducted at Bandlaguda between 9:00 am to 1:00 pm and between 2:00 pm to 4:00 pm in Pocharam.

46.title: Jitendra Awhad booked for outraging BJP leader's modesty, to resign as MLA
46.article_body: NCP leader Dr Jitendra Awhad has been booked for outraging the modesty of a BJP woman leader and has said that he will resign as an MLA. The leader alleged Awahad pushed her on November 13 during a public event. Meanwhile, Awhad claimed police filed two false cases against him. "I will fight against this police brutality," he added.

47.title: Pavement that generates electricity when people walk on it installed in UK; pic released
47.article_body: A new pavement has been unveiled in the UK's Telford that generates electricity when you walk or run on it. Electricity produced from pedestrians or runners using the bouncy section powers mobile phone chargers built into a nearby bench. The pavement has been supplied by technology firm, Pavegen that has launched similar projects in Milan, Hong Kong and Dubai.

48.title: 500 postmen to get e-bikes soon for speedy mail delivery in Pune
48.article_body: At least 500 postmen in Pune will very soon get e-bikes from the government so that they can reach out to citizens conveniently and as soon as possible, without getting tired. Pune region's Postmaster General said, "Currently, e-bikes are being used in [Bengaluru]...The parcel delivery staff has a very good experience of using these bikes."

49.title: Taylor Swift leads MTV EMAs 2022 winner list, bags four awards
49.article_body: Singer Taylor Swift led MTV EMAs 2022 winner list with four awards. The singer won Best Artist, Best Video, Best Pop and Best Longform Video titles at the award ceremony. While accepting her first award for the night, Taylor credited her fans for the win and said that they "are the only reason any of this" happens to her.

50.title: Collegium system for appointment of judges can be improved: Ex-CJI
50.article_body: Former Chief Justice of India TS Thakur said the collegium system for appointment of judges to the higher judiciary can be improved and criticising it without coming up with an alternative “does not lead us anywhere". "Nobody can say that the collegium system for the appointment of judges is the most perfect system," he added.

51.title: PM Modi pays tribute to Jawaharlal Nehru on his birth anniversary
51.article_body: On the occasion of former Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru's birth anniversary, PM Narendra Modi paid homage to him and recalled his contribution to the country. PM Modi tweeted, "On his birth anniversary, tributes to our former PM Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru...We also recall his contribution to our nation." Nehru was born in 1889 and is the longest serving Indian PM.

52.title: BMC planning to allow autos, bikes on one lane of Gokhale bridge: Reports
52.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is exploring possibilities of opening one lane of the now-closed Gokhale bridge for pedestrians, bikes and autos amid complaints of traffic congestion, said reports. The authorities have conducted structural analysis of the bridge and decision of opening one lane after giving additional support to the structure will be made this week, the reports added.

53.title: Jos Buttler has now created his own legacy: Stokes after winning T20 WC
53.article_body: England all-rounder Ben Stokes praised his captain Jos Buttler after winning the 2022 T20 World Cup title, stating that the 32-year-old has now created his own legacy. "You look at how quickly Jos has managed to take control of the team and progress it from the legacy Eoin Morgan left," stated Stokes. "Buttler's decision-making has been absolutely right," he added.

54.title: ED arrests Vijay Nair in Delhi liquor policy case ahead of bail hearing
54.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has arrested businessman Vijay Nair in the Delhi liquor policy case ahead of his bail hearing today. Nair is the former CEO of event management firm Only Much Louder and the reported aide of Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia. Nair was arrested along with businessman Abhishek Boinpally, who allegedly lobbied for certain South India-based businessmen.

55.title: Cristiano Ronaldo claims he is being forced out of Manchester United
55.article_body: Five-time Ballon d'Or winner Cristiano Ronaldo has claimed he is being forced out of Manchester United. During an interview with Piers Morgan, Ronaldo stated that manager Erik ten Hag and two or three senior executives at Manchester United have "betrayed" him and they want him out of the club. Ronaldo has started in just four Premier League matches this season.

56.title: Kolkata's Shlok is the winner of Doodle For Google 2022 India, gets ₹5 lakh scholarship
56.article_body: The winner of the 2022 Doodle for Google competition in India is Shlok Mukherjee from Kolkata, West Bengal. Mukherjee won for his Doodle titled 'India on the Center Stage', featured on Google.co.in today. Google said it is honoured to award Shlok with ₹5 lakh college scholarship and ₹2 lakh technology package for his school.

57.title: Iran issues 1st death sentence to detainee linked to anti-hijab protests
57.article_body: Iran on Sunday issued its first death sentence to a detainee linked to the anti-hijab protests. The detainee was sentenced to death for the crime of "setting fire to a government building, disturbing public order, assembly and conspiracy to commit a crime against national security, and an enemy of God and corruption on earth", the judiciary's Mizan Online website said.

58.title: Ravindra Jadeja urges people to vote for his wife Rivaba in Gujarat polls
58.article_body: Ahead of the Gujarat polls, cricketer Ravindra Jadeja urged the people of Jamnagar to vote for his wife, Rivaba Jadeja, who has been fielded by the BJP. "The Gujarat election is here and it's like a T20 match. My wife is making her grand debut in politics on a BJP ticket," said Jadeja. Rivaba replaced sitting MLA Dharmendrasinh Jadeja.

59.title: Will not be performing at 2022 FIFA World Cup, confirms Dua Lipa
59.article_body: Singer Dua Lipa has confirmed that she will not be performing at the opening ceremony of 2022 FIFA World Cup, which is to be held in Qatar. "I look forward to visiting Qatar when it has fulfilled all the human rights pledges it made when it won the right to host the World Cup," she wrote on her Instagram Stories.

60.title: 5 students arrested for assaulting junior in Hyderabad
60.article_body: Five students of a Hyderabad-based institute have been arrested and a search operation has been launched for seven others for allegedly assaulting an undergraduate student in a hostel room, police said. A video of the assault had gone viral earlier. Police claimed the assault happened after a rift between the victim and his ex-girlfriend. Notably, the accused students were suspended.

61.title: Turning point was Shaheen's injury: Akhtar on Pak losing T20 WC 2022 final
61.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar has said that the "turning point" in the Pakistan-England 2022 T20 World Cup final was Shaheen Afridi's injury. "It's fine...we will win the World Cup in India now," added Shoaib. Shaheen sustained the injury in the 13th over of England's run-chase and went off the field after bowling the first delivery of the 16th over.

62.title: Godrej purchases 2 group housing plots in Noida for ₹377 crore in e-bidding
62.article_body: The Godrej Properties Limited bought two group housing plots in Noida Sector 146 for ₹377 crore, in an e-auction on Friday, Noida authority officials said. The reserve price for a single plot in this scheme is ₹188 crore and Godrej placed the highest bid, the officials added. DLF and Golf Green Mansions were the other eligible developers for e-bidding.

63.title: Crypto industry has a role to protect consumers: Binance CEO
63.article_body: Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao told a gathering of G20 leaders in Bali, "I think the [crypto] industry collectively has a role to protect consumers, to protect everybody...Regulators have a role but it's not 100% their responsibility." "We do need some regulations, we do need to do this properly, we do need to do this in a stable way," he added.

64.title: Earthquake of 4.1 magnitude hits Punjab's Amritsar
64.article_body: The National Center for Seismology confirmed that an earthquake of magnitude 4.1 occurred near Punjab's Amritsar early on Monday morning. It happened at a depth of 120 kilometres, 145 kilometres west-northwest of Amritsar, with latitude of 31.95 degrees and longitude of 73.38 degrees. Earlier on Saturday, Delhi-NCR and some other northern states witnessed earthquake tremors.

65.title: Elon Musk apologises for Twitter being 'super slow', announces new feature
65.article_body: Twitter's new CEO Elon Musk apologised for the micro-blogging platform being "super slow" in many countries. "App is doing >1000 poorly batched RPCs just to render a home timeline," he stated. He also announced that Twitter will role out a new feature soon that will enable organisations to identify which other Twitter accounts are associated with them.

66.title: 2-yr-old girl playing with brothers dies as tempo crushes her in Mumbai
66.article_body: A two-year-old girl died after she was crushed under the wheels of a tempo in a locality in Mumbai, police said on Sunday. The girl was playing with her brothers on a road when the tempo driver did not notice her and the vehicle crushed her. The driver did not stop the vehicle after it hit the girl and escaped.

67.title: Fatima reveals she has epilepsy, says 'was diagnosed during Dangal, woke up at hospital'
67.article_body: Actress Fatima Sana Shaikh took to Instagram to spread awareness about epilepsy, a disorder in which nerve cell activity in the brain is disturbed, causing seizures and revealed that she has been living with the disorder. She said she was diagnosed when she was training for 'Dangal' movie, adding, "I got an episode and woke up straight at the hospital."

68.title: I feel betrayed by Manchester United, I don't have respect for Erik ten Hag: Ronaldo
68.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo has said that he feels betrayed by Manchester United, claiming that manager Erik ten Hag tried to force him out of the club in the summer. "I don't have respect for him because he doesn't show respect for me," Ronaldo said. "I feel...some people didn't want me here, not only this year but last season too," he added.

69.title: Xi Jinping to arrive in Bali for meeting with Joe Biden
69.article_body: China's President Xi Jinping will arrive in Indonesia's Bali on Monday for a meeting with US President Joe Biden ahead of the G20 summit. The leaders have held five phone or video calls since Biden became US President in January 2021. Xi and Biden are expected to discuss Taiwan and Russia's invasion of Ukraine among other topics.

70.title: England players wait for Moeen, Adil Rashid to step aside before champagne celebration
70.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing England players waiting for Moeen Ali and Adil Rashid to step aside before champagne celebration following their win in the T20 World Cup 2022 final against Pakistan on Sunday.  Reacting to the video, a fan tweeted, "Nice gesture by Jos Buttler." "Sort of great sportsmanship," wrote another.

71.title: Students clash over England-Pak T20 WC final at college in Punjab
71.article_body: Some students suffered minor injuries after a clash broke out between students from Bihar and Jammu and Kashmir at a college in Punjab's Moga after T20 World Cup final between England and Pakistan on Sunday. An argument broke out between the students who were watching the match together, police said. Students threw stones at each other, police added.

72.title: Tesla to assist police probing Model Y crash that killed 2 in China
72.article_body: Tesla will assist Chinese police probing the crash of a Model Y car that killed two people and left three injured in Guangdong. A video of the incident showed a Tesla Model Y swerving between lanes at high speed, sideswiping cars and motorcycles before eventually crashing into a storefront. A motorcyclist and a schoolgirl died in the accident.

73.title: Khushi is made for big screen, she's a natural: Janhvi Kapoor
73.article_body: Janhvi Kapoor said that her sister Khushi Kapoor "has been made for the big screen" because of "how natural she is". Janhvi guarantees that there'll be "no pretence in her work" as she's "incapable of being fake". "That is an important aspect of being an actress because every time she acts, it comes from a place of truth," Janhvi added.

74.title: Don’t just flag problems, resolve them: Shah to Intelligence Bureau
74.article_body: The Intelligence Bureau (IB) shouldn't limit itself to preparing reports but get actively involved in resolving internal security issues, from inter-state disputes to radicalisation and terrorism, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said. "He emphasised...IB isn’t just supposed to flag problems...it must get actively involved with issues and try to resolve them," a Home Ministry official said.

75.title: Twitter spends ₹104 crore/year on food service at headquarters in San Francisco: Musk
75.article_body: Elon Musk said that Twitter spent $13 million (around ₹104 crore) per year on food services at its San Francisco headquarters. He said this while dismissing Twitter's former Vice President of Work Transformation Tracy Hawkins' claim that the company spent $20-$25 a day per person. "There are more people preparing breakfast than eating breakfast," Musk added.

76.title: Udaipur track repaired after explosion caused cracks: Railways
76.article_body: After an explosion caused cracks on a railway track in Rajasthan's Udaipur, the track was repaired, Indian Railways informed on Monday. The repair work was completed at 3:30 am and as a precautionary measure, a trial run of a railway engine was done, it added. The explosion occurred hours before the Asarwa-Udaipur Express train was supposed to pass.

77.title: Wouldn't enter Bigg Boss as contestant now, it's brutal: Sunny Leone
77.article_body: Actress Sunny Leone said she's "probably not" open to entering 'Bigg Boss' again as a contestant as, in her opinion, the show has become "brutal". "When I was on the show, it was still a little tame...I don't think I would last, I would just fall apart," she added. Sunny made her Indian television debut with 'Bigg Boss 5'.

78.title: CM Mamata should take action: Assam CM on WB minister's comment on Prez Murmu
78.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma reacted to West Bengal minister Akhil Giri's comment on President Droupadi Murmu, saying CM Mamata Banerjee should take action against him. "Everybody thinks he made the statement deliberately," Sarma added. "Tribal people in Assam filed a complaint against him but it's the responsibility of the CM to take a tough call," he stated.

79.title: Twitter lays off 4,400 contract workers without notice: Report
79.article_body: Twitter fired 4,400 of its 5,500 contract workers this weekend without notice, both in the US and abroad, according to Platformer. Full-time employees said they were not given an internal notice before contractors they were collaborating with were let go. Many contractors found out they had been fired after they abruptly lost access to Twitter's internal systems.

80.title: IMD predicts light rain, below-average temp for Bengaluru today
80.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) predicted light rain for Bengaluru today and said that the temperature will remain below-average (between 19 and 26 degree Celsius) in the city. "Generally cloudy sky. Light rain/thundershowers are very likely. Mist is very likely during early morning hours in some areas," the weather department said. The atmospheric humidity will be around 94%, it added.

81.title: Assam CM asks officials to help elderly woman involved in land dispute, shares video
81.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma has shared a video of his interaction with an elderly woman involved in a land dispute in Kokrajhar. In the video, Sarma can be seen directing the district's DC and SP to resolve the land dispute and make arrangements for the woman to build a house. He tweeted, "God's grace to be able to serve!"

82.title: Team of T20 World Cup 2022 announced by ICC, 2 Indians included
82.article_body: ICC today announced Team of T20 World Cup 2022, which includes four England players and two players each from India and Pakistan. Tournament-winning England skipper Jos Buttler has been named opener, captain and wicketkeeper of the team. Virat Kohli and Suryakumar Yadav have been included as number three and number four batters, respectively. Zimbabwe's Sikandar Raza has also been included.

83.title: Suspect arrested in Istanbul explosion that left 6 dead, 81 injured
83.article_body: The person responsible for bomb attack in Istanbul on Sunday has been arrested by the police, said Turkey's Interior Minister Suleyman Soylu. The bomb explosion had left six people dead and wounded around 81 people. Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan called the explosion something that "smells like terrorism" and added that its perpetrators would be punished.

84.title: UFC star Anthony 'Rumble' Johnson dies aged 38
84.article_body: Two-time UFC title challenger Anthony 'Rumble' Johnson passed away aged 38 on Sunday. "Johnson had been battling an illness for quite some time," his manager Ali Abdelaziz said. Johnson was due to fight for the Bellator light-heavyweight title in September of last year, but pulled out due to a health issue that persisted over the past year.

85.title: SoftBank stock falls 12% in its biggest intraday drop since early 2020
85.article_body: The shares of SoftBank fell 12% on Monday in the biggest intraday drop since the outbreak of COVID-19 in early 2020. The fall followed SoftBank's reporting of investment losses at its Vision Fund unit of over $9 billion in the July-September quarter. However, SoftBank reported a net profit of over $21 billion, marking the first net profit in three quarters.

86.title: Black and yellow taxis in Mumbai to have roof top indicators soon
86.article_body: The Mumbai Metropolitan Region Transport Authority (MMRTA) has made it mandatory for all black and yellow taxis in the city to install the colour-coded indicator by March 31, 2023. The LED indicator will have green, red and white-coloured lights which can tell if the taxi is vacant, hired, or the driver wants to take a break.

87.title: 8-yr-old brain dead girl's family donates her liver, kidneys in Delhi
87.article_body: The family of an eight-year-old brain dead girl, who had fallen down from a certain height in UP's Mathura, has donated her liver, kidneys, corneas and heart valves in Delhi's AIIMS. Mansi's liver and a kidney were transplanted in a five-year-old while her other kidney was given to a 12-year-old child. Her corneas and heart valves have been preserved.

88.title: CAIT to launch e-commerce portal Bharat eMart soon
88.article_body: Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) said that its e-commerce platform Bharat eMart will be launched soon across the country. The portal, first announced in May 2020, will allow traders to set up their e-shops and is expected to compete with platforms such as Flipkart and Amazon. Traders will be taught about data management and usage of AI, CAIT said.

89.title: NCPCR orders probe into religious conversion of 3 kids at childcare centre in MP
89.article_body: NCPCR chief Priyank Kanoongo said the child rights body has taken cognisance of religious conversion of three kids at a state-run childcare centre in Madhya Pradesh's Raisen. He urged local administration to file a lawsuit against the centre's management, which also created paperwork with the kids' new identities and faith. "Religious conversion of kids is a serious matter," Kanoongo tweeted.

90.title: Didn't find material good enough to sustain conviction: Ex-CJI on Chhawla case verdict
90.article_body: Former CJI UU Lalit on Sunday said that the three accused in the Chhawla rape case were awarded the death penalty on the basis of circumstantial evidence. "We didn't find material good enough to sustain...conviction," he told Times Now. He separately told ANI that "unless and until guilt is completely established, circumstantial evidence theory is not to be accepted".

91.title: Who were the highest wicket-takers in T20 World Cup 2022?
91.article_body: Sri Lanka's Wanindu Hasaranga was the highest wicket-taker in T20 World Cup 2022 with 15 scalps. This is the second straight T20 World Cup in which Hasaranga has finished as the highest wicket-taker. Player of the Tournament Sam Curran of England and Netherlands' Bas de Leede took 13 wickets each. Zimbabwe's Blessing Muzarabani took 12 wickets in the tournament.

92.title: Competition law amendments to provide business certainty: Govt
92.article_body: The Ministry of Corporate Affairs (MCA) said that revised timelines proposed in the competition law  amendments will help in providing certainty to businesses. With the Competition Act amendment bill being examined, one proposal is to reduce time limits of mergers and acquisitions to 150 days from 210 days currently. The MCA said that this will make the process time-bound.

93.title: I don't see Rohit Sharma playing in the next T20 WC: Wasim Jaffer
93.article_body: Ex-cricketer Wasim Jaffer said that he doesn't see Indian skipper Rohit Sharma playing in the 2024 T20 World Cup. "I think Rohit is that name for me...Having too many names on the pool sometimes confuses you and that is exactly what happened to the Indian team in the tournament," Jaffer said. Rohit made 116 runs in the 2022 T20 WC.

94.title: He is a champion under pressure: Ex-NZ skipper Fleming on Stokes
94.article_body: Ex-New Zealand skipper Stephen Fleming said that English all-rounder Ben Stokes is a champion under pressure. "Stokes is a big presence...he is a big personality and a big winner. Those are the key ingredients that you need from being a good to a great player," Fleming said. Stokes made 52*(49) against Pakistan in the T20 World Cup final on Sunday.

95.title: Bihar Congress to start extension of Bharat Jodo Yatra on Dec 28
95.article_body: The Bihar Pradesh Congress Committee (BPCC) will start an extension of the Bharat Jodo Yatra in the state from December 28, All India Congress Committee General Secretary Jairam Ramesh said. The Yatra will be undertaken from Banka to Bodh Gaya and will cover 1,200 km and 17 districts, including Patna. A similar yatra will also be undertaken in West Bengal.

96.title: Who were the highest run-scorers in T20 World Cup 2022?
96.article_body: Ex-India captain Virat Kohli top-scored in T20 World Cup 2022 with 296 runs. With this, he became the first-ever batter to finish as highest run-getter in two editions of T20 World Cup. Kohli was the top run-getter in 2014 edition with 319 runs. Netherlands' Max O'Dowd and India's Suryakumar Yadav finished as the second-highest and third-highest run-getters in 2022 edition.

97.title: Telugu producers urge theatres to give preference to straight films during festivals
97.article_body: Telugu Film Producers Council stated theatres should give preference to non-dubbed Telugu films during festivals like Dussehra and Sankranti. The council, in a press release, referred to a resolution it passed in 2019 during an emergency meeting. "Telugu Film Producers Council requests the exhibitors to invariably implement this decision," the statement further read.

98.title: You're a nobody: Harsh to Twitter user who told him to 'stick to acting'
98.article_body: Actor Harsh Varrdhan Kapoor has reacted to a Twitter user after the latter told him to "stick to acting" over the actor's tweet over the football club Chelsea. "There's a reason why you never succeeded as an actor. You should stick to acting," the user had written. Harsh replied, "You're a nobody on Twitter that no one will...care about."

99.title: Third round of India-EU trade pact talks to start from November-end: Report
99.article_body: A delegation from the European Union (EU) is reportedly set to visit India on November 28 for the third round of talks for the India-EU Trade and Investment Agreement, including the Geographical Indications. According to the commerce ministry, the trade agreement with the EU would help India to further expand and diversify its exports of goods and services.

100.title: Pakistani fan recreates 2019 World Cup's viral angry reaction, ICC shares video
100.article_body: A Pakistani fan recreated the 2019 World Cup's viral angry reaction during Pakistan's T20 World Cup 2022 final defeat against England. The ICC shared a video of reaction of both the fans and wrote, "Thought this looked familiar!"  Notably, Pakistani cricket fan Sarim Akhtar had gone viral for staring angrily at Asif Ali after dropped catch during 2019 World Cup.

101.title: At least 6 dead in Istanbul blast, Turkey President says 'There is a smell of terror'
101.article_body: At least six people were killed and several others injured in a blast on a pedestrian street in Istanbul on Sunday. "It might be wrong if we say for sure...this is terror [attack] but according to first signs...there's a smell of terror there," Turkey President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan said. "Relevant units of our state are working to find...perpetrators," he added.

102.title: Met my husband through Ajay Devgn: 'Drishyam 2' actress Ishita Dutta
102.article_body: Actress Ishita Dutta, who'll next be seen in 'Drishyam 2', spoke about her co-star Ajay Devgn and revealed that because of him, she and her actor-husband Vatsal Sheth met and got married. "I met my husband through Ajay sir. I'm very happy that he was our matchmaker," she said. Vatsal is known for starring in 'Taarzan: The Wonder Car'.

103.title: Loved my time in IPL, learnt a lot: Curran after winning T20 WC
103.article_body: After being named the 'Player of the Tournament' and 'Man of the Match' in the T20 World Cup final on Sunday, English seamer Sam Curran said that he learnt a lot during his IPL stint. "I loved my time there (IPL)... It is fantastic learning from guys who have played in these tournaments and big occasions," Curran said.

104.title: Southeast Asia shouldn't become proxy to other powers: Indonesia
104.article_body: Indonesian President Joko Widodo on Sunday said that Southeast Asian countries should avoid becoming proxies to "any powers" and allowing "the current geopolitical dynamic" to turn into a "Cold War" in the region. Widodo's remarks came as Indonesia assumed ASEAN's chairmanship. Notably, there has been a recent rise in tensions between the US and China over Taiwan in the Asia-Pacific.

105.title: Ajay Devgn's 'Drishyam 2' gets U/A certificate, runtime to be 2 hrs 22 mins
105.article_body: Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) has cleared Ajay Devgn and Tabu-starrer 'Drishyam 2' with U/A certificate. The film is expected to have a duration of 2 hours and 22 minutes. According to reports, the film has been passed with zero cuts. Directed by Abhishek Pathak, 'Drishyam 2' is set to release in theatres on November 18.

106.title: The improvement that Sam Curran has done is brilliant: Ian Bishop
106.article_body: Ex-West Indian pacer Ian Bishop said that the improvement that English seamer Sam Curran has made for the T20 World Cup in Australia is "brilliant". "It's not easy to be bowling across all the phases. If you think about...bowling in Australia, you think about really fast...[and] tall bowlers. Curran is among the shortest in this tournament," Bishop said.

107.title: Journalist beaten up with stick at Assam hospital; home guard suspended
107.article_body: A journalist was allegedly beaten up with a stick by a home guard when he had gone to deliver food for a relative admitted to a hospital in Assam's Cachar district on Saturday night. The home guard has been suspended, police said. Doctors have found five severe injuries on the journalist's body.

108.title: Robbers dismantle, steal ATM machine that had ₹10 lakh in Udaipur
108.article_body: A total of 5-6 people dismantled and took an ATM machine away in Rajasthan's Udaipur district, police said on Sunday. According to the bank to which the ATM belonged, the machine had ₹10 lakh in cash. The incident occurred on Saturday night when the accused held the ATM's guard hostage and took the ATM away in a vehicle, police said.

109.title: Tom Holland signs new deal for another 'Spider-Man' trilogy: Reports
109.article_body: Actor Tom Holland has reportedly signed a new deal for another 'Spider-Man' trilogy. It will be developed at Sony Pictures in partnership with Disney and Kevin Feige's Marvel Studios, as per reports. Tom has reportedly "closed a deal" for the yet-to-be-titled 'Spider-Man 4', the follow-up to 2021 film 'Spider-Man: No Way Home'.

110.title: Odisha man removes cobra's fangs with nail cutter, arrested after video surfaces
110.article_body: A man from Odisha has been arrested after a video purportedly showing him extracting the fangs of a king cobra with the help of a nail cutter surfaced online. According to the state Forest Department, the cobra has been rescued from Bileisarda. A case has been registered and further investigation into the incident is underway.

111.title: Rahul beats drum with artists at Maha cultural show, video surfaces
111.article_body: During the ongoing 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', Congress leader Rahul Gandhi was seen beating a drum with artists at a cultural show in Kalamnuri, Hingoli district in Maharashtra. In a video, which has surfaced online, Gandhi can be seen hugging and shaking hands with the artists. The foot march commenced on September 7 from Kanyakumari in Tamil Nadu.

112.title: RRR opening scene took 35 days to shoot, Akshay does 1 film in 40 days: Charan
112.article_body: Actor Ram Charan said that his opening scene in SS Rajamouli's 'RRR' took 35 days to shoot. "Akshay Kumar sir finished a movie in 40 days or so I heard," he added. "I have had a dust allergy since childhood...I had even undergone sinus surgery. Look at my fate, I had to work in dust for 35 days," Ram stated.

113.title: NIA reaches Udaipur railway track site where explosion caused cracks
113.article_body: Those involved in the explosion on a newly opened railway line between Udaipur and Ahmedabad will be severely punished, Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said on Sunday. He said the NIA along with other investigating agencies was at the site. The explosion occurred hours before the recently inaugurated Asarwa-Udaipur Express train from Ahmedabad was supposed to pass on the route.

114.title: Abhishek, Jaya, Shabana attend director Rakesh Kumar's prayer meet
114.article_body: A prayer meeting was held for late actor-filmmaker Rakesh Kumar on Sunday in Mumbai. Abhishek Bachchan, Jaya Bachchan and Shabana Azmi, among other Bollywood celebrities, paid their last respects to the director. Rakesh Kumar passed away on November 10 in Mumbai after a battle with cancer. He was best known for films like 'Mr Natwarlal', 'Khoon Pasina' and 'Yaarana'.

115.title: Only Pakistan could've stretched England this far: Chopra
115.article_body: After Pakistan lost to England in the T20 World Cup final after the former posted a total of 137 runs, ex-Indian batter Aakash Chopra said that Pakistan's bowling "made a match of it". "To be honest, only Pakistan could've stretched England this far. Outstanding bowling unit," Chopra said. England won the match by five wickets with an over to spare.

116.title: 2 children hit by UP Police vehicle on busy street, probe ordered
116.article_body: Two children were hit by a vehicle belonging to the Uttar Pradesh Police on a busy street in Uttar Pradesh's Baghpat district on Saturday. The children were immediately rushed to a nearby hospital, where they received first-aid treatment. According to a senior officer, a probe has been ordered into the incident and a report has been sought within 24 hours.

117.title: FTX logo dropped out of ICC T20 World Cup Final after bankruptcy
117.article_body: The logo of FTX was taken down from the post-match presentation background stands that sport the sponsors' logos, dugouts and boundary triangles in the ICC T20 World Cup final on Sunday. The cryptocurrency exchange declared bankruptcy on Friday. The logos were visible during the semifinal that took place on Thursday and the matches that were played earlier.

118.title: List shows batters who smashed most sixes in T20 World Cup 2022
118.article_body: Zimbabwe all-rounder Sikandar Raza smashed the most number of sixes (11) in T20 World Cup 2022. He is followed by England opener Alex Hales and Sri Lanka opener Kusal Mendis, who slammed 10 sixes each. Four batters, including India's Suryakumar Yadav, slammed nine sixes each, while five batters, including Virat Kohli and KL Rahul, slammed eight sixes each.

119.title: Bowlers have to take lot of credit: Stokes after Eng wins T20 WC 2022
119.article_body: After England won the T20 World Cup 2022 final, all-rounder Ben Stokes said the bowlers have to take "a lot of credit" as they restricted Pakistan to 137 runs. "In finals, especially chasing, you forgot all the hard work that came first," he added. Stokes scored an unbeaten 49-ball 52 to help England win the match by five wickets.

120.title: Congress announces 5th list of 6 candidates for Gujarat Assembly polls
120.article_body: Congress has released its fifth list of six candidates for the Gujarat Assembly polls. The party has fielded Chhattarsinh Gunjariya from Dhrangadhra constituency, Jayant Jerajbhai Patel from Morbi, Mansukhbhai Jadavbhai Kalariya from Rajkot West, Jivan Kumbharvadiya from Jamnagar Rural, Divyesh Manubhai Chavda from Gariadhar and Manhar Patel from Botad. Gujarat elections to be held in December.

121.title: Will cut migration from border villages: Uttarakhand CM Dhami
121.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said that the state government is committed to minimising migration from border villages as they serve as the second line of defence for the country. He added that the government will promote religious and adventure tourism to achieve this, since it will create self-employment opportunities for locals. Dhami inaugurated a 10-day Autumn Festival on Saturday.

122.title: US, Japan, S Korea 'more aligned than ever' on N Korea: Biden
122.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Sunday said that his country, Japan, and South Korea are "more aligned than ever" on North Korea's "provocative behaviour". Following this, US National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan said Biden, Japanese PM Fumio Kishida and South Korean President Yoon Suk-yeol had planned a joint response in case North Korea carries out further nuclear tests.

123.title: BYJU'S expects 3-fold growth in revenue in FY22: Byju Raveendran
123.article_body: BYJU'S expects to register a three-fold growth in revenue and losses to be halved in the financial year 2022, according to Founder and CEO Byju Raveendran. Speaking at Tech Sparks 2022, Raveendran said he sees potential for a million entrepreneurs in the country. He added that four of BYJU'S five integrations are seamlessly done and performing well.

124.title: Your real Twitter account sounds like a parody: Elon Musk to US Senator
124.article_body: Ed Markey, the US Senator for Massachusetts, took to Twitter to complain that a reporter was able to create a verified account impersonating him. Responding to his complaint, Twitter's new owner Elon Musk tweeted, "Perhaps it is because your real account sounds like a parody?" In another tweet, Musk said, "And why does your profile picture have a mask?"

125.title: No need to alter it: CPI(M) leader on rule on women's entry into Sabarimala
125.article_body: Menstruating women are not allowed into the Lord Ayyappa shrine at Sabarimala as he is an "eternal celibate" and there's no need to alter this practice, CPI(M) leader G Sudhakaran said. "It is something we all accept and respect," he said, adding that the minimum age for women to enter hasn't been changed from 60 years.

126.title: He showed he's best leg-spinner in world: Moeen on Rashid's performance vs Pak
126.article_body: England all-rounder Moeen Ali, speaking about Adil Rashid's bowling performance against Pakistan in the T20 World Cup 2022 final, has said, "He showed that he is the best leg-spinner in the world." Moeen stated that Rashid "bowled amazingly well" in the last two matches. Rashid scalped two wickets and conceded 22 runs against Pakistan in the final.

127.title: Proud of the team's efforts, it was just not our day: Naseem Shah
127.article_body: After losing to England in the T20 World Cup final, Pakistani pacer Naseem Shah said that he is proud of his team's efforts. "Couldn't end up on the winning side today but the love and support we got...was immense," Shah said. He added, "It was just not our day,  but we will come back stronger than ever."

128.title: Uganda confirms first Ebola case in country's east amid outbreak
128.article_body: Uganda's Health Ministry on Sunday said that a confirmed case of Ebola had been reported from Jinja city in the country's east. Health Minister Jane Ruth Aceng said the virus was detected in the body of a 45-year-old man who died on Thursday. Prior to this, cases due to the current Ebola outbreak had been confined to central Uganda.

129.title: Only BJP & Cong in Gujarat, never been a 3rd party: PM Modi's brother
129.article_body: Speaking about the prospects of AAP in Gujarat polls, PM Narendra Modi's brother Prahlad Modi said that there have only been two parties, BJP and Congress, in the state and never a third. "In the state of Gujarat, the Congress is now 'shunya' (nil) and the BJP has come to its full force," he added. Gujarat elections are in December.

130.title: Schools closed in TN's Mayiladuthurai tomorrow amid heavy rainfall
130.article_body: A holiday has been declared in all schools and colleges of Tamil Nadu's Mayiladuthurai district on November 14 in view of heavy rainfall, a senior official has announced. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has also issued a red alert in several parts of the state. Chief Minister MK Stalin on Sunday conducted an inspection of the affected areas in Chennai.

131.title: Farah used to strip SRK to do ab check for 'Dard...': Om Shanti Om writer
131.article_body: 'Om Shanti Om' writer Mushtaq Shiekh, in his book 'The Making of Om Shanti Om', revealed Shah Rukh Khan refused to go shirtless for the film's song 'Dard-E-Disco' until he gets six-pack abs. Shiekh added Shah Rukh began working out to get the look. "Every week, Farah Khan (director) would strip Shah Rukh to do an ab check," he revealed.

132.title: Strong anti-incumbency wave against BJP in Gujarat: Ashok Gehlot
132.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said that Gujarat voters will teach BJP a lesson in the upcoming assembly elections as there's a strong anti-incumbency wave in the state. He added, "People have understood that the employment problem is terrible in the state." Gehlot, a senior AICC observer for the Gujarat elections, also said that people were "fed up with rising inflation".

133.title: FTX hit by rogue transactions; millions of dollars in assets removed
133.article_body: After cryptocurrency exchange FTX filed for bankruptcy in US, the company on Saturday said that it had detected unauthorised access to certain assets. Analysts had noticed "hundreds of millions of dollars of assets" were moved from the platform in "suspicious circumstances", Reuters reported. FTX's CEO John Ray said that the company was working with law enforcement to mitigate the problem.

134.title: 78-year-old female beggar raped in Bhopal; 1 arrested
134.article_body: A 78-year-old woman beggar was allegedly raped by a man in Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh. The 37-year-old accused used to sleep on a footpath, which was nearby the victim's hut, and had raped her last month, police said. The woman used to treat the accused like her son and used to give him food as well, police added.

135.title: Delhi Police issues traffic advisory for November 14-27 due to trade fair
135.article_body: Delhi Traffic Police (DTP) has issued a traffic advisory due to India International Trade Fair, which will be held at Pragati Maidan from November 14-27. Commuters are advised to avoid Mathura Road, Bhairon Marg, Ring Road, Shershah Road and Purana Quila Road due to traffic congestion, DTP said. Parking on Mathura Road and Bhairon Marg is prohibited, DTP added.

136.title: Richa Chadha to star in an Indo-British production
136.article_body: Actress Richa Chadha is set to play the lead role in an Indo-British production. The project, which will be helmed by a British director, will go on floors in January. Talking about the upcoming project, Richa said, "I've wanted to work outside of India, but I never pursued it actively till the opportunity presented itself...and I could not say no."

137.title: 99% Muslims in India are Hindustani by their ancestry: RSS leader
137.article_body: RSS leader Indresh Kumar on Sunday said 99% of the Muslim population in India is "Hindustani" by their ancestry, culture, traditions and motherland. "We must consider our duty towards our nation as supreme and above all other things as per the directives and tenets of the Holy Quran," he added. "All of us share the common DNA," Kumar further said.

138.title: MCD poll tickets sold for ₹2-3 cr, says AAP leader who climbed tower
138.article_body: AAP's former councillor Haseeb-ul-Hasan climbed an electricity tower on Sunday, miffed over being denied a ticket for the upcoming municipal polls and alleged that the party leaders had "sold" the tickets for ₹2-3 crore. He alleged that party leaders Atishi, Durgesh Pathak and Sanjay Singh will be responsible if he were to die, adding that they took his original documents.

139.title: Shoaib Akhtar responds to Mohammad Shami's 'karma' tweet using Harsha Bhogle's statement
139.article_body: Shoaib Akhtar responded to Mohammad Shami's 'karma' tweet using Harsha Bhogle's remark following Pakistan's defeat in T20 World Cup final. "Sorry brother...It's called karma," Shami had written responding to Akhtar's 'broken heart' emoji tweet. Sharing a picture of Bhogle's tweet wherein he praised Pakistan by calling them 'Best bowling team', Akhtar wrote, "This is what you call sensible tweet."

140.title: Pakistan can't win the T20 World Cup by just bowling: Mohammad Kaif
140.article_body: Former Indian cricketer Mohammad Kaif reacted to the T20 World Cup final's outcome by tweeting, "Lesson from this World T20: Pakistan can't win Cup by just bowling, India can't win Cup by just batting." He added, "England has batters, spinners, pacers, fielders, and luck." England beat Pakistan by 5 wickets on Sunday to win the T20 World Cup.

141.title: PM Modi to have 20 engagements during visit to Bali for G20 summit
141.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will reportedly have around 20 engagements during his nearly 45-hour stay in Indonesia's Bali for the G20 summit. He will leave for Bali on Monday. PM Modi will participate in key sessions on food and energy security, digital transformation, and health at the G20 summit, Foreign Secretary Vinay Kwatra had earlier said.

142.title: Chadwick was excited about introducing Talokan in Black Panther 2: Ryan
142.article_body: 'Black Panther: Wakanda Forever' director Ryan Coogler has revealed that late actor Chadwick Boseman was excited about introducing Talokan in the film. "I remember we were at a restaurant...the first time we talked about possibly having indigenous American representation in the film. He got the biggest smile, like, 'They're never going to see this coming'," Ryan added.

143.title: It's pro-India, but try to understand tragedy of Kashmir: Sudhir on 'Tanaav'
143.article_body: Sudhir Mishra has said 'Tanaav', the filmmaker's web show which follows a group of Indian intelligence agents tracking down a terrorist organisation in Kashmir, is "definitely pro-India". "But you also try and understand...tragedy of things in Kashmir. The innocent bystanders caught in the conflict as collateral damage," he added. 'Tanaav' is an adaptation of Israeli thriller series 'Fauda'.

144.title: IMF chief warns of risks to global economy from US-China rivalry
144.article_body: During an interview, International Monetary Fund (IMF) Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva warned of risks to the global economy from the rivalry between the United States and China. Georgieva said, "We may be sleepwalking into a world that is poorer and less secure as a result." She further described tariffs put on Chinese imports under then-US President Donald Trump as counterproductive.

145.title: Marathi TV actress Kalyani Jadhav dies after tractor knocks her down from 2-wheeler
145.article_body: Marathi TV actress Kalyani Kurale Jadhav was killed in a road accident on Saturday night. A tractor knocked her down from her two-wheeler near Kolhapur on Sangli-Kolhapur road, police said. The accident took place at around 11 pm. The 32-year-old actress had appeared in Marathi television serials like 'Tujhyat Jeev Rangala' and 'Dakkhancha Raja Jyotiba'.

146.title: How much prize money did each team get at T20 World Cup 2022?
146.article_body: Winners England received a total prize money of $1.74 million, which includes $140,000 bonus from Super 12 stage and $1.6 million for winning the tournament. Runners-up Pakistan won $920,000, while losing semi-finalists India and New Zealand received $560,000 and $540,000, respectively. Netherlands and Sri Lanka got a total of $230,000 each.

147.title: Shinde govt came into being due to corruption & fear: Cong's Patole
147.article_body: Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole on Sunday alleged that the Eknath Shinde-led government in the state came into existence because of corruption and out of fear. Patole added that the state cabinet wasn't being expanded because the government can collapse. "One cabinet minister is in charge of six districts. What is happening in Maharashtra?" he asked.

148.title: Iran criticises German Chancellor over his remarks on protests
148.article_body: Tehran on Sunday criticised German Chancellor Olaf Scholz for expressing support for anti-government protesters in Iran, and for backing the prospect of further EU sanctions against the Iranian government. He had also condemned Tehran's crackdown on the protests. Scholz's "provocative, interfering and undiplomatic" comments would cause "damage over the long term", Iran's Foreign Ministry said.

149.title: 'Pushpa 2' teaser to be shown before 'Avatar...' in theatres: Reports
149.article_body: The teaser of 'Pushpa: The Rule - Part 2' will be shown before the shows of 'Avatar: The Way of Water' in cinemas, according to reports. The James Cameron directorial will release on December 16. 'Pushpa: The Rule - Part 2', directed by Sukumar, stars Allu Arjun, Rashmika Mandanna and Fahadh Faasil, among others.

150.title: Sonam shares her pregnancy journey, says 'I don't have stretch marks'
150.article_body: Sonam Kapoor, who welcomed her child in August, took to Instagram Stories and shared her pregnancy journey. Sonam wrote she took the help of a book 'Gentle Birth Method' which is authored by Dr Gowri Motha "I've followed her blindly," she wrote. Sharing a picture of two products, Sonam wrote she doesn't have any stretch marks by using those products.

151.title: India should consider playing overseas T20 leagues for experience: Fleming
151.article_body: Ex-cricketer Stephen Fleming said that Indian players should consider playing in foreign T20 leagues to gain more exposure. "It seems like a number of these players who are playing around the world are getting really important experience," Fleming said. He added, "CPL (Caribbean Premier League)...becomes more important with the next World Cup being there (West Indies and United States)."

152.title: Production at Vedanta-Foxconn plant to begin within 2.5 years: Anil Agarwal
152.article_body: Vedanta Resources Chairman Anil Agarwal said production at its semiconductor and display manufacturing unit in Gujarat will start within two and a half years of the groundbreaking ceremony. Vedanta-Foxconn would invest ₹1,54,000 crore to install the facility, Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel had said after an MoU between the Gujarat government and a joint venture of the companies was signed earlier.

153.title: 4 JNU students barred from campus till inquiry into last week's violence is done
153.article_body: After last week's violence in JNU, four students have been barred from campus till an inquiry into the incident is completed. Two students were injured in a clash between two groups at the university on Wednesday night. Orders issued to the students state that anyone giving shelter to the four students on the university premises will invite strict disciplinary action.

154.title: Delay in expansion to ensure right partner for EV business: Ashok Leyland
154.article_body: Ashok Leyland Executive Chairman Dheeraj Hinduja said the company is in advanced discussions with investors for its electric vehicle business. He added that the delay was to ensure that the company has the right partner to support its growth plans. Hinduja said the company was also planning to launch electric vehicles under Switch Mobility in the Middle East.

155.title: Digital rupee critics missing the big picture: Zerodha Co-founder
155.article_body: Zerodha Co-founder Nikhil Kamath defended the digital rupee, saying that those critical of the Central bank Digital Currency (CBDC) might be missing the big picture. "Remittances, unbanked economy, and reducing subsidy leakage, to name a few," Kamath tweeted. "When anything new comes into the market, the old need to adapt, and the new need to regulate the change," he added.

156.title: Guj has better facilities for Vedanta-Foxconn plant over Maha: Anil Agarwal
156.article_body: Vedanta Chairman Anil Agarwal said that Gujarat was chosen over Maharashtra for the Vedanta-Foxconn plant because it was providing better facilities for the unit. Speaking at the HT Leadership Summit, he added, "The company will create a hub for manufacturing of iPhones and TV equipment at Maharashtra." Vedanta-Foxconn will invest ₹1,54,000 crore to set up the facility.

157.title: European energy crisis will benefit India's Reliance, Nayara: Report
157.article_body: Reliance Industries and Nayara Energy are expected to benefit from the ongoing energy crisis in Europe, according to a report, as these are among the Asian refiners that produce winter-specification diesel for the European Union. According to the report, since the Ukraine war began, Reliance and Nayara have imported almost 10 times more Russian crude from the pre-invasion levels.

158.title: Bahamas police interview FTX’s Bankman-Fried amid mystery outflows: Report
158.article_body: FTX’s Sam Bankman-Fried was interviewed by the Bahamian police and regulators on Saturday, Bloomberg reported. The questioning came a day after FTX had detected unauthorized access and analysts said about $662 million in tokens mysteriously flowed out of both FTX’s international and US exchanges. Bankman-Fried resigned as chief executive officer of FTX Group on Friday.

159.title: Maha man tricks daughter into writing suicide note blaming relatives, kills her
159.article_body: A 40-year-old man was arrested for tricking his 16-year-old daughter into writing a suicide note implicating his relatives, asking her to enact the extreme step and later killing her in Maharashtra. The accused told the deceased girl to tie a noose around her neck, clicked a picture and then kicked the stool, which led to her death, an official said.

160.title: India-US bilateral trade may reach $500-600 billion by 2030: Piyush Goyal
160.article_body: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said he believes that bilateral trade between India and the US will reach $500-600 billion by 2030. Speaking on whether India will join the Indo-Pacific Economic Framework for Prosperity, Goyal said it depends on what India will get in return. The US looks at India as its friend and a trusted partner, he added.

161.title: Adani Group open offer to buy 26% stake in NDTV to launch on Nov 22
161.article_body: Adani Group on Friday announced that its open offer to buy an additional 26% public shareholding in NDTV will open for subscription from November 22. The offer for acquiring 1.67 crore equity shares at an offer price of ₹294/share will tentatively close on December 5, a regulatory filing showed. The Adani group acquired a 29.18% stake in NDTV in August.

162.title: Sajid Khan, Shiv Thakare used me as vote bank in Bigg Boss: Nagori
162.article_body: Bigg Boss 16 contestant Gori Nagori, who was recently eliminated from the show, said co-contestant Shiv Thakare was using her. "For him and even Sajid Khan, we were only vote banks. If you call us friends, behave like one. But they always looked down upon us," she added. She further called Sajid, MC Stan and Sumbul Touqeer Khan weak contestants.

163.title: Well done: Sitharaman on seizure of 61 kg gold by Mumbai Customs
163.article_body: After Mumbai Airport's Customs officials seized 61 kg of gold worth ₹32 crore, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said, "Appreciate Mumbai Customs for your alertness." "Your timely action has borne a stunning outcome. Well done," Sitharaman added. "This was the highest-ever seizure in a single day. Seven passengers were arrested," Customs officials said in a statement.

164.title: Anyone casting evil eye on India is given befitting reply: Rajnath
164.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh has said that safeguarding national interests is the main focus of the BJP-led central government. He said that anyone casting an evil eye on India is now given a befitting reply, adding, "India is no longer weak." Referring to the 2016 surgical strikes and 2019 Balakot airstrikes, he said "soldiers have proved this time and again".

165.title: Army chief Gen Manoj Pande embarks on 4-day visit to France
165.article_body: Indian Army chief General Manoj Pande on Sunday embarked on a four-day visit to France where he will meet the French military leadership. The visit is aimed at enhancing India-France defence ties, the Indian Army said. General Pande will also lay a wreath at the Neuve-Chapelle Indian Memorial, which commemorates the sacrifices of 4,742 Indian soldiers during World War 1.

166.title: List of most polluted cities in India today released
166.article_body: As per the Central Pollution Control Board's latest data, Bihar's Motihari is the most polluted city in India today, with an AQI of 413. It's followed by Purnia (378), Bettiah (377), Siwan (372), Araria (340), Katihar (337), Saharsa (322), Samastipur (317), Darbhanga (316),  Buxar (313), Hisar (311), Fatehabad (306), Delhi (303) and Singrauli (302). Only Motihari is in 'severe' category.

167.title: Video shows the moment explosion occurred at Istanbul's busy pedestrian street
167.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media showing the moment when an explosion occurred on Istanbul's popular pedestrian street, Istiklal Avenue, that left people dead and injured. The video showed flames erupting and a loud bang, as pedestrians turned and ran away. Other footage showed ambulances, fire trucks and police at the scene of the explosion.

168.title: 42, including 25 students, injured as bus falls into gorge in J&K
168.article_body: As many as 25 students were among the 42 passengers injured in a road accident in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri district. The driver lost control of the vehicle and it fell into the roadside gorge. The injured persons were evacuated to a nearby hospital and five of them were later shifted to GMC Jammu for advanced treatment, officials said.

169.title: Siddhaanth's wife shares their first-ever pic together after actor's death, pens note
169.article_body: Alesia Raut, the wife of actor Siddhaanth Vir Surryavanshi who passed away at 46 while working out at a gym, took to Instagram on Sunday to share their first picture together from 2017. Raut wrote, "I love you and always will love you till I am alive." She added, "I know you will be always guiding me as an angel."

170.title: Curran 1st cricketer to win Player of the Final, Player of the Tournament awards in a T20 WC
170.article_body: England pacer Sam Curran on Sunday created history by becoming the first cricketer to win Player of the Final and Player of the Tournament in a single edition of T20 World Cup. Curran bagged Player of the Final award after taking three wickets against Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022 final. He bagged the tournament award for taking 13 wickets.

171.title: J&K is victim of Centre's wrong policies: Cong leader Ghulam Mir
171.article_body: Congress leader Ghulam Ahmad Mir said that Jammu and Kashmir is a victim of the Centre's "wrong policies". "Only Congress is capable enough to defeat the divisive and anti-people policies of the BJP," Mir said. He added, "The tall claims about the development of J&K, fake narrative built up...[is] reflecting the absolute failures...of the BJP government on all fronts."

172.title: Explosion occurs on busy pedestrian street in Istanbul, several injured
172.article_body: An explosion took place on a busy pedestrian street in Turkey's Istanbul, with several people reported to be injured. A video has surfaced online showing ambulances, fire trucks and police at the scene in Istiklal Avenue. The video also showed flames erupting, with pedestrians running away. The cause of the explosion is not yet clear.

173.title: Rapid growth of urbanisation not matched by urban infra development: RBI
173.article_body: In a report on Municipal Finances, RBI said that the rapid growth of urbanisation in India has not been accompanied by a corresponding increase in urban infrastructure. It said, "[This] is reflected in the performance of the urban local bodies, especially municipal corporations (MCs)." "MCs' committed expenditure in the form of establishment expenses...but capital expenditure is minimal," it said.

174.title: Not possible: Rajiv Gandhi assassination convict Nalini on meeting Gandhis
174.article_body: After her release from prison on Saturday, Nalini Sriharan, a convict in former PM Rajiv Gandhi's assassination, said that it wasn't possible to meet the Gandhi family. Furthermore, she said that she felt "very sorry" when asked about her message for the Gandhis and the families of those who were killed. "They have lost their dear ones," Nalini said.

175.title: 11 charged over killing of Iranian militia member during unrest
175.article_body: Eleven people, including one woman, have been indicted over the killing of a Basij militia force member during anti-hijab protests in Iran, state media reported on Saturday.
