Among those indicted, some were charged with "corruption on earth", which carries the death penalty. The activist HRANA news agency said 336 protesters had been killed in the unrest as of Friday.

176.title: Sister's kidney was best match: Tejashwi on transplant for father Lalu
176.article_body: Ailing RJD supremo Lalu Prasad Yadav's son and Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav, while talking about his sister's decision of donating a kidney to their father, on Sunday said, "My sister's (Rohini Acharya) kidney turned out to be the best match." "The doctors wanted someone from the family to donate a kidney to my father," Tejashwi added.

177.title: Raveena shares old pics with Juhi on latter's birthday, pens note
177.article_body: Actress Raveena Tandon took to Instagram on Sunday to wish Juhi Chawla on the occasion of her 55th birthday. Sharing a series of old pictures with Juhi, she wrote, "Happy birthday my darling Ju." "May your infectious laughter, lighten up our days always! Many many years of love and happiness," Raveena added.

178.title: WB couple, child lodged in jail on suspicion of being Bangladeshi infiltrators
178.article_body: A West Bengal couple, along with their one-and-a-half-year-old child, has been reportedly lodged in a Bengaluru jail for over three months on suspicion of being Bangladeshi infiltrators. The couple got employment at a waste segregation unit in Karnataka's Sulibele village, their relatives said. But they were arrested within a month, they added.

179.title: All Pak pacers can bowl 140 plus, bowling attack better than India: Jaffer
179.article_body: Former Indian batter Wasim Jaffer said that the Pakistani bowling attack is better than the Indian attack. "[In] the fast bowling, they have got Shaheen Shah Afridi, Haris Rauf and Naseem Shah and they all bowl 140 plus. Rauf can easily touch 150 and he is bowling really well," Jaffer said. He added, "[Indian] bowling looks weaker than our batting."

180.title: When I got my first paycheck, I bought groceries for the house: Rajkummar
180.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao has revealed that his first paycheck was ₹300, which he got when he was in the eighth standard. He added that he used to give dance tuitions to a girl at her house. "When I earned my first ₹300, I went to buy groceries for...house. And I bought small quantities of everything," Rajkummar said.

181.title: Electricity supply to be cut if consumers don't pay bills for 3 months: BESCOM
181.article_body: Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM) on Friday said that if a consumer does not pay the electricity bill for three consecutive months, action will be initiated to cancel the electricity supply contract. The consumer will then have to apply for a new electricity connection, BESCOM added. Meanwhile, BESCOM has asked consumers to not pay their bills online this month.

182.title: China's daily COVID-19 cases cross 14,000
182.article_body: Coronavirus cases are rising in China as the daily case count on Saturday rose to 14,288, up from a nationwide tally of 11,323 on Friday. China's daily COVID-19 cases have stayed above 10,000 since breaching that level last week for the first time since April. Guangdong, Henan, Beijing, Chongqing and Inner Mongolia remain the places with the most COVID-19 outbreaks.

183.title: Banned PFI's absconding student wing leader arrested in Bengaluru
183.article_body: A leader of the student wing of banned Popular Front of India (PFI) was arrested in Bengaluru on Friday night and taken to Guwahati on Sunday, police said. The absconding leader, Amir Hamza, was hiding with some families from Tripura. A search operation was conducted at Hamza's residence and incriminating documents and posters against BJP, RSS and ABVP were recovered.

184.title: BBMP proposes white-topping 39 B'luru roads at a cost of ₹1,449 cr
184.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has sought approval from the government to white-top 39 more roads, at an estimated cost of ₹1,449 crore, officials said. Among the key roads that will be white-topped are the Outer Ring Road (ORR) from Silk Board to KR Puram, Indiranagar Double Road, Indiranagar 12th Main Road and Kammanahalli Main Road, among others.

185.title: Mumbai passengers won't be fined for not wearing seat belts till Nov 15
185.article_body: After facing criticism for enforcing penalties on motorists without conducting awareness drives, the Mumbai Traffic Police has temporarily paused the seatbelt action, which was to be implemented from November 1. We made people aware of seat belts in the first ten days and now action will be taken against those not wearing them from November 15 onwards.

186.title: Hot air balloon crashes twice in Austrian Alps; 9 injured
186.article_body: A hot air balloon crashed twice in the Austrian Alps on Saturday, injuring nine people, authorities said. The pilot and co-pilot, along with two passengers, reportedly fell off the carriage during a hard landing. Following this, the balloon took off again with its five remaining passengers and landed after the pilot passed instructions for an emergency landing to the passengers.

187.title: Explosion causes cracks on Udaipur railway track, train services suspended
187.article_body: An explosion took place on a newly-opened railway line in Rajasthan's Udaipur on Sunday, hours before the Asarwa-Udaipur express train was supposed to pass, police said. The movement of trains was suspended after officials were alerted by local residents, who spotted cracks on the railway track. "We have found some explosives on the track," a senior police officer said.

188.title: 3 rob passengers in moving bus at knifepoint in Delhi; arrested
188.article_body: Three men were arrested for allegedly robbing passengers in a moving bus in Delhi's Kalyanpuri area, police said on Saturday. The accused, who were carrying knives and daggers, snatched phones and wallets from all the passengers while the driver was asked to continue on the same route. The accused were identified with the help of technical surveillance, an officer said.

189.title: 2 arrested for taking away goods worth ₹77 lakh from saree shop in Thane
189.article_body: Two persons were arrested for allegedly taking away goods worth ₹77 lakh from a saree shop which they ran in partnership with a businessman in Thane, Maharashtra. The accused were arrested from Parbhani with the help of the CCTV footage and intelligence inputs, police said. Several items, including sarees, a computer and a printer, were recovered from the accused.

190.title: Mumbai airport Customs seize 61 kg gold worth ₹32 cr, biggest 1-day seizure
190.article_body: In the biggest one-day seizure, Mumbai airport's Customs officials seized 61 kg of gold worth ₹32 crore in two different cases and arrested seven passengers. In the first case, four passengers were arrested for concealing gold bars in specially designed waist belts with multiple pockets. In the second case, three passengers were arrested with around eight kg of gold.

191.title: Rajnath defends India's G20 logo, says 'Lotus is symbol of India's heritage'
191.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said that the lotus is not just BJP's logo, but was also declared the national flower in 1950 since it's a symbol of India's heritage. The use of the symbol was criticised by Opposition parties, and Singh said that the row was unnecessary. "Should we forget that the lotus flower is a national symbol?" he asked.

192.title: Sorry brother, it's called karma: Shami to Akhtar as Pakistan lose T20 WC 2022 final
192.article_body: Team India fast bowler Mohammad Shami responded to former Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar's tweet wherein he posted a 'broken heart' emoji following Pakistan's defeat in T20 World Cup 2022 final against England. "Sorry brother...It is called karma," Shami wrote. Earlier, Akhtar had mocked India for not taking a single wicket in their semi-final match against England.

193.title: India International Trade Fair to begin tomorrow in Delhi
193.article_body: The 41st edition of the annual India International Trade Fair will begin on Monday at Delhi's Pragati Maidan. Over 2,000 exhibitors will participate in the "Vocal for Local, Local to Global" themed 14-day fair. While the event is reserved for business visitors from November 14-18, it will open for general public from November 19-27 from 10 am to 7:30 pm.

194.title: Shadab Khan breaks record for taking most wickets for Pakistan in T20I cricket
194.article_body: Leg-spinner Shadab Khan on Sunday broke the record for taking most wickets for Pakistan in T20I cricket. With his one wicket in the T20 World Cup 2022 final against England, Shadab took his tally of wickets for Pakistan in T20I cricket to 98. He overtook Shahid Afridi, who took 97 wickets for Pakistan in T20I cricket.

195.title: Man sets shop, vehicles on fire in Gurugram for being kicked out of Satsang
195.article_body: A man was booked for allegedly torching a furniture shop and two vehicles in New Basti in Gurugram's Sector 8. The incident happened after the accused, Harish, was slapped and kicked out of a Satsang (religious gathering) for arriving there in an inebriated state, police said. Notably, the furniture shop was owned by the organiser of the Satsang, Parmeshwar Kumar.

196.title: Factory worker dies after colleague pumps air into rectum for fun in UP
196.article_body: A 47-year-old factory worker died after his colleague allegedly inserted an air compressor pipe into his rectum 'for fun' in UP's Kanpur on Friday. The deceased fell unconscious after the pipe, which is used to clean dust, was inserted into his rectum. Rania Police Station in-charge Atul Gautam said that the victim died of excessive internal bleeding.

197.title: Siddhaanth & I stopped talking, I regret not calling him: Neha Marda after actor's death
197.article_body: Days after television actor Siddhaanth Vir Surryavanshi passed away at 46 while working out at the gym, his co-star Neha Marda told ETimes, "I am feeling so bad that after we had a disagreement over something, we stopped talking to each other." She added, "Now I regret not calling him. Had I made that call, we would've been friends again."

198.title: England become first-ever team to hold both ODI and T20 World Cups at the same time
198.article_body: England have become the first-ever team to hold both ODI and T20 World Cups at the same time. England, who won the T20 World Cup 2022 today after defeating Pakistan in the final, are also the defending ODI world champions having won ODI World Cup in 2019. England had beaten New Zealand in the 2019 final.

199.title: Ben Stokes smashes fifty in T20I cricket for the first time ever
199.article_body: England all-rounder Ben Stokes on Sunday smashed his T20I career's first-ever fifty. The 31-year-old scored an unbeaten 52 off 49 deliveries to help his team defeat Pakistan in the T20 World Cup 2022 final. Stokes hit five fours and a six in his knock. His previous highest score in T20I cricket was 47*(30), which came against South Africa in 2020.

200.title: Who is Nishad Singh, a core team member of the now-bankrupt FTX?
200.article_body: Nishad Singh worked as the Director of Engineering at FTX, the US crypto exchange that filed for bankruptcy. He was reportedly a part of FTX's 30-year-old Founder Sam Bankman-Fried's inner circle that lived in a luxury penthouse in the Bahamas. Singh, who previously worked at Facebook, Alameda Research and Berkeley Consulting, did his BSc from the University of California, Berkeley.

201.title: No actor wanted to work with us during 'Maine Pyar...': Sooraj Barjatya
201.article_body: Filmmaker Sooraj Barjatya revealed that no actor wanted to work with his company Rajshri Productions while he was making 'Maine Pyar Kiya'. "Our last few films were a flop...we were suffering financially...one day, I met a young man who we'd rejected after his first screen test. But there was something about him...That man was Salman Khan," he added.

202.title: West trying to militarise Southeast Asia: Russian Foreign Minister
202.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov on Sunday accused the West of seeking to militarise Southeast Asia in a bid to contain Russian and Chinese interests. This comes ahead of the Bali G20 summit of state leaders where the Russian delegation led by Lavrov will come face-to-face with Western leaders, the first such meeting since the beginning of the Ukraine war.

203.title: Serial liar, says BJP on Rahul's privatisation of 150 railway stations remark
203.article_body: Press Information Bureau (PIB) fact-checked Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's claims that the Central government has privatised over 150 railway stations in the country and called the claims "completely bogus". Responding to the development, BJP leader Shehzad Poonawalla said, "Rahul Gandhi is a serial liar and this is not the first time that he has been caught with his lies."

204.title: England defeat Pakistan to win T20 World Cup after 12 years, equal West Indies' record
204.article_body: England defeated Pakistan by five wickets in the T20 World Cup 2022 final in Melbourne to win T20 World Cup after 12 years. England restricted Pakistan to 137/8 in 20 overs and went on to chase down the target in 19 overs. With this, England have equalled West Indies' record for winning most T20 World Cup titles (two).

205.title: Varun is the most enthusiastic person I've ever met: 'Bhediya' director
205.article_body: 'Bhediya' director Amar Kaushik said in an interview that actor Varun Dhawan is the most curious and enthusiastic person he has ever met. "Not just in the industry, but in my entire life. He's the first person to call me every morning...He'll constantly ask questions about his character, like - 'Can we do this, can we do that'," Amar added.

206.title: Manjima Mohan-Gautham Karthik to get married on Nov 28: Report
206.article_body: Actors Manjima Mohan and Gautham Karthik, who made their relationship official on October 31 via an Instagram post, are reportedly getting married on November 28 this year. The wedding will reportedly take place in Chennai. As per a report, the couple will also host a reception in Ooty and Chennai for their friends and colleagues after the wedding.

207.title: Dimple Yadav to file nomination for Mainpuri bypolls tomorrow: Report
207.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav's wife Dimple Yadav is likely to file her nomination papers for Mainpuri bypolls on Monday, senior party leader Alok Shakya said. The Mainpuri bypolls will be held on December 5 and the result will be declared on December 8. Notably, Mainpuri Lok Sabha seat fell vacant following the demise of Mulayam Singh Yadav in October.

208.title: 3 people rob 18-year-old of jewellery worth ₹18 lakh in Mumbai, booked
208.article_body: Three people have been booked for allegedly stealing diamond jewellery worth ₹18 lakh from an 18-year-old man in Mumbai. They posed as priests and asked the victim to buy flowers for puja. When he ignored them, one of them asked him to make five rounds on that path as a punishment. They then ran away with the jewellery.

209.title: 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' revealed real identity of Rahul Gandhi: Kanhaiya Kumar
209.article_body: Congress leader Kanhaiya Kumar hailed the party's "Bharat Jodo Yatra" and said that the march revealed the real identity of MP Rahul Gandhi. "Women are also meeting Rahul Gandhi comfortably during the yatra…The first leg of [yatra] has been completed and the second stage of the journey will be based on the unfulfilled promises of the BJP government," said Kanhaiya.

210.title: Robbers open fire and loot ₹25 lakh from courier office in Pune
210.article_body: A gang of robbers opened fire and looted ₹25 lakh from a courier office in Pune's Market Yard area on Saturday, the police said. CCTV footage showed that five men barged into the office and one of them broke the building's glass exterior and fired a round in the ground. "We have formed teams to trace them," an official said.

211.title: 'Metaverse' theme park to be built near 'Statue of Prosperity' in Bengaluru
211.article_body: Karnataka minister Ashwath Narayan confirmed that the government is building a new "metaverse" theme park near the "Statue of Prosperity" to attract tourism. "The...park would have tiny lakes, cultural symbols...and 'metaverse' experiences to depict rich heritage and tech prowess...[It] will be integrated with sacred soil and water, collected from various villages of Karnataka," said Narayan.

212.title: Priyanka Gandhi questioned me about her father's killing in jail, cried: Nalini Sriharan
212.article_body: Nalini Sriharan, one of the convicts freed in former Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi's assassination case on Saturday, said that Priyanka Gandhi Vadra met her in the Vellore Central Prison in 2008 and asked about the killing of her father. "She got emotional for her father. She cried too," said Sriharan. She added that she told Priyanka Gandhi whatever she knew.

213.title: Shehzad Poonawalla shares 'Lootera' poster, says 'How AAP looted Delhi'
213.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party's Shehzad Poonawalla took to Twitter to share a poster with Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia's picture on a bike. 'Lootera' can be seen written on top of the poster. "How AAP looted Delhi," Poonawalla wrote on Twitter. He also shared the poster at a press conference earlier today.

214.title: Polling party suspended after EVMs found in private vehicle amid Himachal Pradesh polls
214.article_body: A polling party has been suspended after it was allegedly caught transporting Electronic Voting Machines in a private vehicle by Congress workers in Himachal Pradesh's Rampur amid state Assembly elections. "We found...Polling Party No.146 was carrying EVM/VVPAT machine in a private vehicle...and prima facie found the party has not followed due procedures," Returning Officer Surender Mohan said.

215.title: 100% false: Twitter's ex-employee as Musk calls Twitter 'biggest click driver'
215.article_body: A former Twitter employee denied Elon Musk's claim of Twitter driving a massive number of clicks to other websites/apps and being the "biggest click driver on the internet". Claire Diaz-Ortiz, who worked at Twitter for over five years, tweeted, "Lies...This is 100% false & Twitter knows it." She added, "Twitter is much lower on traffic than Facebook and LinkedIn."

216.title: Prankster 'Rahul Ligma' fakes to be fired by FTX after Twitter; video goes viral
216.article_body: The prankster who uses the name 'Rahul Ligma' and made some media persons believe that he was a fired Twitter employee a couple of weeks ago, has now faked being fired by troubled crypto exchange FTX. In a video, he said, "It is really tough. This is my second job in a month." He added, "Everything just changed so quickly."

217.title: Don't know how well he knew Siddhaanth: Rajev on Vivek's 'hyper-gymming' remark
217.article_body: Rajev Paul, reacting to Vivek Agnihotri's "hyper-gymming" remark following Siddhaanth Vir Surryavanshi's demise, said the actor was "very careful of his diet". "I don't know how well [Vivek] knew him," he added. Mourning his demise, Vivek tweeted, "Mad rush to build aggressive body without any medical advice is so dangerous. Hyper-Gymming is a relatively new phenomenon...It needs to be regulated."

218.title: Faked stomach ache to help Padmini run away & get married: Mithun
218.article_body: Actor Mithun Chakraborty shared that he helped actress Padmini Kolhapure to run away and get married to producer Pradeep Sharma. "I faked a stomach ache in front of everyone so that she could run away, get married and come back," Mithun recalled, adding that he continued to act till Padmini didn't return to the sets. Padmini married Pradeep in 1986.

219.title: Promised ₹500, got ₹200 to attend PM's rally in K'taka: Group
219.article_body: A group of people, including labourers, staged a protest in Karnataka's Chikkaballapur district on Saturday alleging that a local BJP leader paid them ₹200 each for attending PM Narendra Modi's rally near Bengaluru. They claimed they were promised ₹500. Police said the issue was resolved amicably after local leaders met them and addressed their concerns.

220.title: Chinese military flew 36 fighter jets and bombers near island: Taiwan
220.article_body: The Taiwanese Defence Ministry claimed the Chinese military flew 36 fighter jets and bombers near Taiwan. On Saturday, ten of the aircraft flew across the median line in the Taiwan Strait which separates the island from the mainland. Taiwan also claimed it spotted four Chengdu J-10 fighters, a Y-8 antisubmarine warfare plane and three H-6 bombers southwest of the island.

221.title: Have to dismantle what we made: Akshay on Bollywood films not performing
221.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar, speaking about the poor performance of Bollywood films, has said, "We have to dismantle what we have made." He added that the viewers' choices have changed "rapidly" after the pandemic. "It is our fault, it is not the audiences' fault that they are not coming (to theatres). We have to give them what they want," he added.

222.title: FPIs invest nearly ₹19,000 crore in equities in November as dollar weakens
222.article_body: Foreign investors have invested ₹18,979 crore in Indian equities so far in November, data with the depositories showed, amid moderating trend in the US inflation and softening of the dollar. The net outflow was at just ₹8 crore last month and at ₹7,624 crore in September. The total FPIs outflow in equities has reached ₹1.5 lakh crore in 2022.

223.title: Punjab bans public display of arms, songs glorifying violence to fight gun culture
223.article_body: The Punjab government issued an order on Sunday banning the public display of arms, both online and offline. Songs glorifying violence were also banned. Weapon licenses issued so far will be reviewed within three months and no license will be issued unless the District Collector is satisfied. Further, celebratory firing that can endanger lives will be punishable.

224.title: Man collapses while dancing, dies of heart attack in Raj; video surfaces
224.article_body: A 42-year-old man died of a heart attack after he collapsed while dancing at a marriage ceremony in the Pali district of Rajasthan. A video of the incident, which has surfaced on social media, shows the man happily dancing before he suddenly collapses on stage and dies. His family members took him to a hospital, where doctors declared him dead.

225.title: France confirms Iran has detained another 2 of its citizens
225.article_body: The French Foreign Ministry on Saturday confirmed news reports about two French citizens being held in Iran, without giving further details. On Friday, the newspaper Le Figaro reported that two French nationals had been arrested in Iran prior to the start of anti-hijab protests in September. This brings the total number of French nationals being detained in Iran to seven.

226.title: Sembcorp Industries to acquire Vector Green Energy for ₹2,780 crore
226.article_body: Sembcorp Industries announced that its wholly-owned subsidiary Sembcorp Green Infra will acquire Vector Green Energy for ₹2,780 crore to expand its renewable energy portfolio in India to 3GW. The acquisition will be funded through internal cash resources and external borrowings. The completion of the acquisition will bring the group's gross renewable energy capacity to 8.5GW.

227.title: October retail inflation to be below 7%: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das
227.article_body: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Governor Shaktikanta Das said that retail inflation in October is expected to remain below 7% as the union government and central bank have taken various measures. In September, the retail inflation rate was 7.41% and in August it was 7%. To tackle inflation, the RBI has raised the repo rate three times since May.

228.title: AAP is a failed political startup: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma
228.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma criticised AAP, saying that the party is a failed political startup. He claimed that the AAP has not progressed as it has been trying to sell the same product for the last 10 years without any proof. "Even after 10 years, they haven’t progressed to become an MSME (Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises)," said Sarma.

229.title: Ayodhya mosque construction likely to be completed by Dec 2023: Trust
229.article_body: The Indo-Islamic Cultural Foundation has said that the construction of the mosque in Ayodhya is expected to be completed by December 2023. The construction of all proposed structures, including a hospital, library, community kitchen and research centre, will start simultaneously but the mosque is likely to be completed first because of its small size, the trust's secretary told PTI.

230.title: I want to reduce my fees by 30% to 40%: Akshay Kumar on reducing cost of movie outing
230.article_body: Addressing ways to bring down the cost of movie outing, actor Akshay Kumar said there are many things that can be done by actors, producers and theatres. "I want to bring down my fees by 30% to 40%," he stated. "We've to work on the cost of me, the cost of making film. Everything needs to be addressed," he added.

231.title: Mumbai woman pays ₹60 lakh to astrologer to get 'complete control' over husband; 2 booked
231.article_body: Mumbai Police have booked an astrologer and another man for allegedly cheating a 38-year-old woman of nearly ₹60 lakh under the pretext of helping her take "complete control" over her businessman husband through 'black magic'. The woman had met the astrologer on Instagram. Police said that her former boyfriend mediated between her and the astrologer.

232.title: Voted for Tharoor so that manipulators like Assam CM are never promoted: Cong leader
232.article_body: Congress leader Sandeep Dikshit on Sunday said that he voted for Shashi Tharoor in the recently concluded party Presidential polls, to ensure that people like Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma are not promoted. His comments came a day after CM Sarma said that he expects those who voted for Tharoor in the elections to join BJP soon.

233.title: Are you serious?: Namita to Twitter user who called Shark Tank just a 'show'
233.article_body: Shark Tank India judge Namita Thapar responded to a Twitter user who ridiculed the show and tweeted, "Mam TRP bhi kuch hota hai (Madam, there's something called TRP)…It's a show, not a real investors pitch!" Thapar responded, "Are you serious? Because it's my 'real' money I'm putting in." She added, "What do you mean by it's not a real pitch?"

234.title: Direct flight from Pune to Bangkok launched, to operate 4 days a week
234.article_body: Union Minister of Civil Aviation Jyotiraditya Scindia on Saturday inaugurated a direct flight from Pune to Bangkok. The SpiceJet's flight will operate between Pune-Bangkok-Pune four days a week on every Tuesday, Thursday, Saturday and Sunday. Scindia said that this air connectivity will encourage the bilateral exchange between India and Thailand in the domain of trade, education and investment.

235.title: Bengaluru airport's T2 will be operational after 30-45 days
235.article_body: Kempegowda International Airport's CEO Hari Marar on Saturday said that Terminal 2 of the Bengaluru airport was equipped to handle at least 25 million flyers annually. Speaking just a day after PM Narendra Modi inaugurated the new terminal, Marar said that the terminal would only be operational after 30 or 45 days. Security sweeps have to be done, Marar added.

236.title: Sam Curran records best bowling figures by a fast bowler in a T20 World Cup final
236.article_body: England fast bowler Sam Curran on Sunday recorded the best bowling figures by a fast bowler in a T20 World Cup final. The 24-year-old took three wickets for 12 runs in his four-over spell against Pakistan in the T20 World Cup 2022 final in Melbourne. Curran took a total of 13 wickets in T20 World Cup 2022.

237.title: Was called Salman's brother, Malaika's husband, it used to bother me: Arbaaz
237.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Arbaaz Khan said in an interview that when he was called Salman Khan's brother and Malaika Arora's husband, it used to bother him. "But, you know, I guess there are things that you can't change," he added. "There's no point changing people's mindset...the exercise of proving things to people is such a futile exercise," said Arbaaz.

238.title: Wanted to be Bruce Lee & do what he used to do: Akshay Kumar
238.article_body: Akshay Kumar said he "wanted to be Bruce Lee" and explained how martial arts helped him in his acting career. "I just wanted to do what he used to do," Akshay said, adding that he calls himself a "stuntman first, actor next". Addressing why Hindi films are failing at box office, Akshay stated that Bollywood needs to "dismantle" and "reinvent".

239.title: Akshay wanted ₹90 cr for 'Hera Pheri 3', Kartik asked for ₹30 cr: Report
239.article_body: Producer Firoz Nadiadwala reportedly discussed 'Hera Pheri 3' simultaneously with actors Akshay Kumar and Kartik Aaryan. "Akshay quoted ₹90 crore...plus some share of profit as his remuneration...whereas Kartik was willing to do it for ₹30 crore", a source said. "Film was fetching...₹15 crore lesser from satellite...digital players for Kartik as compared to Akshay," the source added.

240.title: Malaika is strict, I'm an indulgent father: Arbaaz on son Arhaan
240.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Arbaaz Khan opened up about his and ex-wife Malaika Arora's parenting approach towards their son Arhaan Khan. Calling himself "a little indulgent as a father", Arbaaz said that Malaika is "a good mother", who is "strict but friendly". "I pamper Arhaan...I just want to see him get everything he wants and be happy," Arbaaz shared.

241.title: Set up dedicated dengue hospitals in each district in UP: CM Yogi
241.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Saturday issued directives for opening dedicated dengue hospitals in each district in the state amid a rise in cases. Yogi said this during a high-level review meeting with the state health department authorities. He added that facilities for platelet and dengue testing should also be available in every district of the state.

242.title: Man's warning triggers evacuation of building before collapse in France
242.article_body: A four-storey building in the French city of Lille was evacuated before dawn on Saturday, hours before it collapsed in the morning hours, authorities informed. The building was evacuated after a man returning home at 3 am alerted emergency services about cracks appearing in the structure, authorities said. A person who was rescued from the rubble sustained only light injuries.

243.title: It's humiliation: Locals as PCMC seizes movable assets of tax defaulters
243.article_body: Locals have described the Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation's (PCMC) decision of confiscating movable assets of property tax defaulters as a "public humiliation" of citizens. Ex-chief of the PCMC standing committee Seema Savale said, "This decision...to seize the TV, fridge and vehicles of tax defaulters is wrong itself." Over 8,000 defaulters face the prospect of losing movable property.

244.title: Man arrested for raping 9-year-old girl in MP; minor's condition critical
244.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh Police arrested a 32-year-old man for allegedly kidnapping and raping a nine-year-old girl in Indore. The incident took place when the girl was sleeping with her parents in a small hut-like structure at a construction site. According to the police, the victim has been admitted to a hospital and her condition is stated to be critical.

245.title: Uttarakhand revokes production ban on Baba Ramdev's 5 products, calls it an ‘error’
245.article_body: Uttarakhand Ayurveda and Unani Licensing Authority on Saturday revoked its order of ban on production of five products from Baba Ramdev's Divya Pharmacy. "We issued...previous order hastily and it was an error," Uttarakhand drug regulator Dr GCS Jangpangi said. The state authority had ordered a ban on production of BPgrit, Madhugrit, Thyrogrit, Lipidom and Eyegrit Gold tablets.

246.title: Unidentified person kills 35-year-old man inside his house in Ghaziabad
246.article_body: An unidentified person killed a 35-year-old man by slashing his throat inside his house in the wee hours of Saturday in Ghaziabad. "There were noises heard by neighbours from the victim's house. [Victim's wife] saw an assailant run away through the terrace of the house. [The victim] was lying dead in a pool of blood," said SP of Ghaziabad (rural).

247.title: PM Modi not just a 'feku master' but 'U-turn ustad': Congress
247.article_body: Congress' Jairam Ramesh on Sunday said that PM Narendra Modi is not just a "feku master", but a "U-turn ustad". His comments came after the Centre filed an affidavit in the SC, emphasising the benefits of the National Food Security Act (NFSA). PM Modi, when he was the CM of Gujarat, had said that the bill would raise hunger issues.

248.title: 19-year-old biker falls 40 feet from a bridge, dies in Mumbai
248.article_body: A 19-year-old man died after he allegedly lost control of his bike and fell 40 feet from a bridge in Mumbai. A police officer said that while the bike was found on the bridge, the teenager was found dead with severe head injuries below, according to a report. An accidental death case has been filed in the matter.

249.title: Imams group asks Gurugram admin to stop namaz in undesignated places
249.article_body: A Gurugram-based association of Imams urged the district administration to stop some groups from offering namaz in undesignated public spaces of the city. The association submitted a memorandum to the administration citing that such acts could lead to communal disharmony and tension. Notably, several Hindu outfits have been protesting against Friday namaz in public spaces in Gurugram since 2018.

250.title: Hyd institute suspends students who beat youth over Prophet remark
250.article_body: A Hyderabad-based educational institute has suspended a group of students who were caught on camera assaulting a third-year law student after he allegedly insulted Prophet Muhammad. "The institution has acted with alacrity and has taken a decision to suspend all the concerned students with immediate effect. The institution has zero tolerance towards such undesirable acts," it said.

251.title: US President Biden calls Cambodia as Colombia at ASEAN summit, video goes viral
251.article_body: A video of US President Joe Biden calling Cambodia, which is hosting the ASEAN summit, as Colombia on Saturday has gone viral. "Now that we're back together here in Cambodia, I look forward to building even stronger progress than we've already made, and I want to thank the Prime Minister of Colombia for his leadership," Biden said.

252.title: If Sridevi got scripts like Meryl Streep's, she'd have won Oscars: Hussain
252.article_body: Actor Adil Hussain, during an interview, said the late actress Sridevi was "underutilised" in the film industry. He explained himself, "The kind of scripts she deserved...imagine her getting scripts which Meryl Streep gets...I somehow feel (with) her talent, hard work, dedication to make a character alive with truthfulness, she'd have won several Oscars," he added. Sridevi passed away in 2018.

253.title: Binance stops accepting deposits of FTX's FTT token
253.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchange Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao has said that the platform has stopped accepting deposits of FTX's FTT token, urging other rival exchanges to do the same. Binance has stopped FTT deposits "to prevent [the] potential of questionable additional supplies affecting the market". Earlier, Binance ended a deal to acquire FTX, which later filed for bankruptcy.

254.title: 11-yr-old boy waiting for auto dies after Jawhar bus depot wall collapses
254.article_body: An 11-year-old boy died while another teenager from the same family was injured after the Jawhar bus depot wall collapsed on them in Maharashtra. The family was visiting the area from Gujarat's Rajkot. Reports said that their parents had gone to the main road to get an autorickshaw and the boy and the other teenager were waiting on the spot.

255.title: Lalit Modi clarifies why he left India after receiving '20,000 questions' on LinkedIn
255.article_body: Ex-IPL Chairman Lalit Modi has clarified why he left India, saying that he has received over 20,000 questions regarding it on LinkedIn. Lalit said that he had no choice, citing media trial. He stated that journalists stirred things. He further stated that the government was not after him. He also citied 'fixing mafia' and jealously in BCCI as the reasons.

256.title: Selectors will take hard calls, but let's not talk about wholesale changes: Gavaskar
256.article_body: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said there's no need for a "knee-jerk reaction" following India's exit from the 2022 T20 World Cup. "I know there are issues that can be looked at...but let's not talk about wholesale changes just because we lost," stated Gavaskar. "Had we gone to the final, we would've been talking about...the XI," he further said.

257.title: SS Rajamouli confirms 'RRR 2', says father is 'working on the story'
257.article_body: Director SS Rajamouli has confirmed that the sequel of 'RRR' is in development and his father and writer V Vijayendra Prasad is working on its story. "We discussed a bit about 'RRR 2' and he's working on the story," he said at an event. 'RRR', starring Jr NTR and Ram Charan, has reportedly collected over ₹1,100 crore worldwide.

258.title: J&K's Doda to be branded as role model in lavender farming: Union Minister
258.article_body: Union Minister Jitendra Singh has said that Jammu and Kashmir's Doda will be branded as a role model in India in lavender farming as farmers are taking it up on a commercial scale due to high profits. Singh said this while reviewing lavender cultivation in Doda. Nearly 400 farmers are involved in lavender cultivation in Doda, PTI reported citing officials.

259.title: Blinken meets Jaishankar, says, 'US supports India's G20 Presidency'
259.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Sunday met India's External Affairs Minister Dr S Jaishankar. After the meeting, Blinken tweeted, "The US supports India's G20 Presidency." Jaishankar called it a good meeting and added, "Discussed Ukraine, Indo-Pacific, energy, G20 and bilateral relations." India will preside over the G20 Summit from December 1.

260.title: Mukesh Ambani enters race to buy Liverpool Football Club: Reports
260.article_body: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani has reportedly entered the race to buy Liverpool Football Club. As per reports, the current owners of the club, Fenway Sports Group (FSG) are willing to sell the club for £4 billion. FSG had taken charge of Liverpool in 2010. FSG stated earlier this week they would be open to listening to offers for Liverpool.

261.title: 2016 Mumbai escalator to be removed, activist says '₹30 lakh will be wasted'
261.article_body: After Central Railway's decision to remove a 2016 escalator to make way for a new railway over bridge in Mumbai's Vidyavihar, RTI activist Anil Galgali has alleged that ₹30 lakh of public money will be wasted. He said the escalator's cost will go to waste due to CR's "bad planning" and that ₹2 lakh will be spent on its removal.

262.title: Video shows woman sticking head out of sunroof of car in Mumbai; police takes action
262.article_body: Mumbai Traffic Police has ordered action against a woman after a video showed her sticking her head out of a speeding car. A Twitter handle shared the video and wrote, "Sunroof is for letting the Sun in & Not the Head out." Responding to the video, police said, "We're sharing your concern with Bandra Traffic Division for necessary stringent action."

263.title: Elon gets a lot of hate, no one wants to be him: Musk's mother
263.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's mother Maye Musk in a BBC documentary in the UK said her son is a genius and that because of his success he "gets a lot of hate". She admitted that despite many people admiring Musk's achievements, "no one wants to be him". Earlier, Maye said Bloomberg's headlines on Tesla are "always on the negative side".

264.title: Why are England players wearing black armbands in T20 WC 2022 final against Pakistan?
264.article_body: England players are wearing black armbands in the T20 World Cup 2022 final against Pakistan. This is in tribute to David English, who died aged 76 following a heart attack. David was founder of Bunbury Festival, an annual cricket tournament for Under-15 players. The festival has helped foster careers of 1,000 first-class cricketers in England, including 125 international cricketers.

265.title: Put up a good fight: Afridi wishes Pakistan for T20 World Cup final vs England
265.article_body: Ex-Pakistan cricketer Shahid Afridi took to Twitter to send his wishes to Babar Azam-led Pakistan for their T20 World Cup final against England. "This day has a special spot in our nation's heart...Wishing you all the best boys, put up a good fight. May you win," he tweeted. Pakistan entered the final after defeating New Zealand in the semi-final.

266.title: Man accuses sister-in-law of doing black magic, kills her in Pune
266.article_body: An FIR has been filed in Pune's Chandan Nagar Police Station after a 59-year-old man allegedly murdered his 54-year-old sister-in-law after accusing her of performing black magic on their family. The incident took place on Friday during a religious function at a person's house. The accused had also claimed that the deceased wasn't letting him meet his mother.

267.title: Slain boy's mother to contest by-election in Muzaffarnagar's Khatauli
267.article_body: The mother of the slain boy, Gaurav, has filed her nomination as an independent candidate for the by-election from Muzaffarnagar's Khatauli. The seat was declared vacant following the disqualification of BJP MLA Vikram Saini, who was convicted in the riots. Gaurav and his cousin were killed by a mob after the murder of Shahnawaz Qureshi over road rage.

268.title: AAP leader climbs tower after being denied ticket in MCD polls
268.article_body: AAP's former councillor Haseeb-ul-Hasan climbed a high-tension tower in Delhi's Shastri Park on Sunday after he was denied a ticket for the upcoming MCD polls. A video of the incident has surfaced. He claimed that AAP kept all the documents which he had submitted hoping to get a ticket. On Saturday, AAP released its final list of 117 candidates.

269.title: Hyd-origin man wins US' North Carolina senate race, elected 3rd time
269.article_body: Mujtaba Mohammed, whose family hails from Hyderabad, won the North Carolina senate race in the US. "I have officially been re-elected to my third term in the North Carolina senate," he tweeted after the results of mid-term elections were announced. Mohammed's parents lived in Hyderabad and migrated to the US in the 1980s. He will represent Mecklenburg County's 38th district.

270.title: Gurugram Police arrest 5 for abducting, sexually assaulting 30-year-old man
270.article_body: The Gurugram Police arrested five people for allegedly abducting and sexually assaulting a 30-year-old man after he failed to repay ₹2 lakh, borrowed from one of the accused. According to the police, the accused took the victim to Manesar, forced him to consume alcohol and then assaulted him. The accused also broke the victim's mobile phone and stole his car.

271.title: Hate & kill, then fete & reward: Mahua on BJP's poll ticket to Godhra MLA
271.article_body: While speaking about the Bharatiya Janata Party giving a poll ticket to Godhra MLA, Chandrasinh Kanaksinh Raulji, who had earlier called Bilkis Bano's rapists 'sanskari', TMC leader Mahua Moitra said that "this is the Gujarat Model". "Godhra MLA who called Bilkis case rapists & killers 'Sanskari Brahmins' is re-nominated by BJP...Hate & Kill. Then Fete & Reward," she tweeted.

272.title: England to field first in T20 World Cup 2022 final vs Pakistan, playing XIs out
272.article_body: England captain Jos Buttler won the toss and elected to field first in T20 World Cup 2022 final against Pakistan. Both England and Pakistan are fielding the same playing XIs that featured in the semi-finals. Pakistan are playing a T20 World Cup final after 13 years, while England are featuring in T20 World Cup final after six years.

273.title: BJP busy distorting history, why can't Tipu's statue be built: Siddaramaiah
273.article_body: Former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah gave his approval a day after Congress MLA Tanveer Sait promised to build a 100-foot-tall Tipu Sultan's statue and accused the BJP of distorting history. "Why can't Tipu's statue be built? Let them build, doesn't he deserve it? [The] BJP twists history. What did they say about...Ambedkar and others? They say false things," said Siddaramaiah.

274.title: Entire village on sale for ₹2 crore in Spain; pic surfaces
274.article_body: The entire Spanish village, Salto de Castro, is on sale for €260,000 (roughly ₹2 crore). The village reportedly has 44 homes, a hotel, a church, a school, a municipal swimming pool, a sports area and an old Civil Guard barracks. "I'm selling because I'm an urban-dweller and cannot maintain the upkeep," the man who bought the village in 2000s said.

275.title: No foul play in his death: Rajev on Siddhaanth Vir Surryavanshi
275.article_body: Actor Rajev Paul said that there "was no foul play" in the death of Siddhaanth Vir Surryavanshi, who passed away on Friday at the age of 46. Rajev added that he has "lost a brother" and shared that he was "genuinely very careful of his diet". "His daughter is my godchild. Maybe it was just his time," he mentioned.

276.title: Bring the trophy home, lads: Harry Kane, coach Southgate on Eng's T20 WC final
276.article_body: England men's football team manager Gareth Southgate and captain Harry Kane took to social media to send their best wishes to the England men's cricket team for their T20 World Cup final against Pakistan today. "We will be watching and hopefully, you can bring that trophy home. The whole country is behind you," said Kane.

277.title: Info Edge's net profit falls 97.99% to ₹168 cr in September quarter
277.article_body: Naukri-parent Info Edge recorded a fall of 97.99% year-on-year in its net profit to ₹168.10 crore in the September quarter. Its revenue increased by 51.22% to ₹531.82 crore in the quarter, up from ₹351.68 crore in the corresponding quarter last fiscal. Info Edge's total income stood at ₹581.75 crore, 47% up from ₹395.72 crore recorded a year ago.

278.title: Who has hit the most sixes in a T20 World Cup final?
278.article_body: Ex-West Indies all-rounder Marlon Samuels holds the record for smashing most sixes in a T20 World Cup final. He slammed six sixes against Sri Lanka in 2012 final against Sri Lanka. He's followed by Pakistan's Misbah-ul-Haq, India's Virat Kohli, West Indies' Carlos Brathwaite and Australia's Mitchell Marsh, who slammed four sixes each in 2007, 2014, 2016 and 2021 finals, respectively.

279.title: Who have won 'Player of the Match' award in finals in T20 World Cup history?
279.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan was named Player of the Match in T20 World Cup final in 2007. Ex-Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi won it in 2009. In 2010, England's Craig Kieswetter won the award, while Sri Lanka's Kumar Sangakkara won it in 2014. In 2012 and 2016, West Indies' Marlon Samuels won the award. Australia's Mitchell Marsh bagged it in 2021.

280.title: Hyderabad student beaten by a group of boys in hostel over Prophet remark, video surfaces
280.article_body: Police have registered a case against a group of students of the ICFAI Business School in Hyderabad after a video of a student being assaulted surfaced. The victim said he was beaten because of a personal chat with a girl, wherein he allegedly insulted Prophet Muhammad. He said he was kicked in his testicles and was threatened to be killed.

281.title: Driver fails to escape vehicle as landslide hits in Kerala, washed away
281.article_body: A 45-year-old man who was allegedly driving a tempo traveller failed to escape from the vehicle as a landslide hit the Munnar-Vattavada road in Kerala's Idukki. He was washed away in the landslide, police said. "All other vehicles and passengers managed to escape but he is suspected to have been trapped inside the vehicle," police added.

282.title: Drones detected along India-Pak border doubled in 2022: BSF DG
282.article_body: The number of drone flights detected along the India-Pakistan international border has more than doubled this year, according to the BSF Director General (DG) Pankaj Kumar Singh. He said that of the total 266 drone flights detected, 215 drone flights were seen in Punjab this year. Singh was speaking at the inauguration of the BSF Drone Forensic Laboratory.

283.title: 5 BJP leaders threaten to contest as independents in Guj polls
283.article_body: At least five BJP leaders have threatened to contest as independents in the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections after being denied tickets. They are Harshad Vasava, Madhu Shrivastav, Dinesh Patel, Satish Patel and Arvind Ladani. Vasava filed his nomination from Nandod as an independent on Friday. Meanwhile, state minister Harsh Sanghavi said, "BJP is like a family and all members...are united."

284.title: 'Twilight' actor Taylor Lautner marries girlfriend Taylor Dome; pics surface
284.article_body: 'The Twilight Saga' actor Taylor Lautner and his longtime girlfriend Taylor Dome got married at Epoch Estate Wines in US' California on Friday. Around 100 of their closest friends and family members attended their wedding. The couple reportedly began dating after meeting in 2018 and got engaged in November last year.

285.title: We knew we were better than them: Shadab on India-Pak T20 WC match
285.article_body: Pakistan all-rounder Shadab Khan, during an interview ahead of their 2022 T20 World Cup game against England, recalled their match against India during the group stage and said that though they lost that game, they knew they were the better side. "We knew if we give our 100 per cent, the result will come on our side," he added.

286.title: Feel good: Biden as Dems retain control of Senate in mid-term polls
286.article_body: After the Democrats retained control of the US Senate in mid-term elections, President Joe Biden said, "I know I'm coming in stronger...I feel good and I'm looking forward to the next couple of years." Democrats will now have 50 seats in the 100-member Senate with the Republicans currently on 49. Senator Catherine Cortez Masto won from Nevada.

287.title: What have been the highest and lowest totals scored in finals in T20 World Cup history?
287.article_body: Australia's 173/2 in T20 World Cup 2021 final against New Zealand is the highest total in a T20 World Cup final. It's followed by New Zealand's 172/4 in last year's final, which Australia successfully chased. Sri Lanka's 101 against West Indies in 2012 final is lowest total, while India's 130/4 against Sri Lanka in 2014 final is the second-lowest total.

288.title: Glenn Maxwell slips and falls during a birthday party, breaks his leg
288.article_body: Australia all-rounder Glenn Maxwell broke his leg during a birthday party in Melbourne. The 34-year-old cricketer and the person celebrating his 50th birthday were running in a backyard when both slipped and fell, with Maxwell's leg becoming trapped under the other person's. Maxwell underwent surgery on Sunday and has been ruled out of cricket for an extended period.

289.title: Not SRK but his bodyguard was stopped at airport over luxury watches: Mumbai Customs
289.article_body: Mumbai Customs clarified that officials stopped Shah Rukh Khan's bodyguard Ravi Singh at airport for violating customs rules and not the actor. "The bodyguard had two luxurious watches and four empty watch boxes. Apart from this, there was also an empty box of an iWatch Series 8 in his luggage," Mumbai Customs said. They had to pay ₹6.83-lakh custom duty.

290.title: I'm a legend because I've surpassed struggles in life: Mithun
290.article_body: Actor Mithun Chakraborty said that he's not legendary because of hit films, but he's a legend because he "surpassed all the pains and struggles" in his life. "I've fought a lot to prove myself in this (film) industry," he added. The actor mentioned that he doesn't want a biopic on himself because it'll "never inspire anyone" to achieve their dreams.

291.title: Took 11 yrs, but the wait was worth it: Bosco on directorial debut
291.article_body: Choreographer-turned-director Bosco Martis said that it took 11 years for him to make his directorial debut. Bosco, who directed the recently released film 'Rocket Gang', said the wait was "worth it". "I was tested but with every year, I grew and learnt something," he said, adding that dance will 'always be' an integral part of his storytelling.

292.title: Woman injured after leopard attacks her in Mumbai's Aarey colony
292.article_body: A 34-year-old woman was injured after a leopard attacked her in Mumbai's Aarey colony, police said on Saturday. The leopard had pounced on the woman, who was returning from her workplace, after she ran on seeing the animal and fell down, a police official said. This is the second such incident to take place in the area this month.

293.title: I voted for Tharoor but won't join BJP ever: Cong leader's reply to Assam CM
293.article_body: Following Assam CM's claim that 1,000 Congress leaders who supported Shashi Tharoor in INC polls will likely join the BJP soon, Congress leader Salman Soz stated that he will never join the BJP, even if it becomes the only party left. "I was one of the 1,072 delegates who voted for Tharoor...We lost, but internal party democracy won," Salman tweeted.

294.title: Campuses must become incubators for startups: Goyal to institutes
294.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal in an interaction with the heads and senior faculty members of IIFT and NID, among others, said that every campus must become an incubator for startups and "must strive to nurture and develop innovation and entrepreneurship". He asked the institutions to introspect if their education is tailormade to cater to the needs of tomorrow.

295.title: Life hasn't given you tight slaps: Shweta to Navya in talk over women's issues
295.article_body: Shweta Bachchan said it is very easy for her daughter Navya Naveli Nanda, as a 24-year-old, to say one should "block out noise" while industries work on attacking women's self-esteem. "You are young...life hasn't given you...a few tight slaps," she told Navya. "There is too much economics behind women not feeling like they look like a million bucks," Shweta said.

296.title: 'Drunk' driver rams car on footpath in Pune; 2 people injured
296.article_body: At least two people were injured after a car driver rammed the vehicle on a footpath and dragged one of them for a few metres in Pune. "We've detained the car driver and found that he was under the influence of alcohol," a senior police inspector said. According to a complaint, the car driver lost control of the vehicle.

297.title: Shall hesitate to go to his funeral: Amitabh on director Rakesh Kumar
297.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan said that he "shall hesitate to go to" filmmaker Rakesh Kumar's funeral, who passed away on November 10. "I shall not be able to bear the sight of an inert Rakesh," he said, adding that he left "an imprint that is hard to remove or forget". He called Rakesh "a most affable and kind hearted human".

298.title: TRS MP donates ₹1 cr to govt hospital in Hyd where he was born
298.article_body: TRS Rajya Sabha MP Santosh Kumar J on Friday donated ₹1 crore to a government hospital in Hyderabad where he was born. Telangana Health and Finance Minister Harish Rao Thanneeru said the funds will be used for the development of the maternity hospital in Petlaburj. "It is commendable that Santosh remembered the hospital where he was born," Rao added.

299.title: Bengaluru South School Leaders' Council holds first meet at BJP MP's office
299.article_body: The Bengaluru South School Leaders' Council held its first meeting on Saturday at the office of BJP MP Tejasvi Surya. Over 40 student leaders from around 25 schools attended the meeting and discussed the future action plan. The Council will also host a sports event for government school students in December. The Council is responsible for conducting quarterly events.

300.title: Australia to consider banning paying of ransoms to cyber criminals
300.article_body: Australia will consider making the paying of ransoms to cyber hackers illegal, Home Affairs Minister Clare O'Neil said. This comes after Australia's biggest health insurer, Medibank, was hit by a massive cyber attack last month. Singapore Telecommunications-owned telecom company Optus, along with at least eight other companies, have been breached since September.

301.title: UK influencer who had 18 surgeries to look like Korean woman says 'want to be man again’
301.article_body: A year after British-born influencer Oli London revealed he underwent 18 cosmetic surgeries to look like a Korean woman, he announced, "I'm no longer trans and have gone back to living as a man." London said that identifying as 'transracial' was a "big mistake", adding, "I just want to be a boy." He wanted to resemble BTS singer Park Jimin.

302.title: FTX ex-CEO denies flying to S America, says he's in Bahamas
302.article_body: Former CEO of bankrupt crypto exchange FTX Sam Bankman-Fried has denied rumors that he has flown to South America. He told Reuters he was in the Bahamas. Earlier, Flightradar24 tweeted that the former crypto billionaire was flying from Nassau to Argentina. Bankman-Fried stepped down as CEO of FTX the day it filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in the US.

303.title: Remote employee not disclosing location costs US startup $30,000
303.article_body: US-based GravyWork CEO Alex Atwood told the WSJ that he received notices for not registering his business in Texas and California and was asked to pay $30,000 in taxes and fees. This happened after a former software engineer worked from those states for long periods without informing him. He said the estimated price GravyWork paid for the issue was $500,000.

304.title: People of north India should see us as victims, not killers: Rajiv Gandhi case convict
304.article_body: RP Ravichandran, one of the six convicts who was released on Saturday in the assassination case of former Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi, said that the people of north India should see them as "victims instead of terrorists or killers". "Time and power determine who is a terrorist or a freedom fighter but time will judge us as innocent," he added.

305.title: Hundreds of activists protest at COP27 in Egypt, enter UN territory
305.article_body: Hundreds of environmental activists staged a demonstration at the ongoing UN climate summit in Egypt, known as COP27, and called on industrialised nations to pay for the impact of global warming. The protesters marched through the conference's 'Blue Zone' which is considered United Nations' territory. Subsequently, German officials raised concerns about surveillance and intimidation of delegates.

306.title: Family of brain dead 18-month-old girl donates her organs in Delhi
306.article_body: The family of an 18-month-old girl, Mahira, who was declared brain dead at Delhi's AIIMS, has donated her organs. A native of Haryana, Mahira fell from her house's balcony. Her liver was transplanted in a six-month-old child at the Institute of Liver and Biliary Sciences, while both her kidneys were transplanted successfully in a 17-year-old boy at AIIMS.

307.title: I am very sorry for them: Rajiv Gandhi assassination convict Nalini Sriharan to Gandhis
307.article_body: After her release from prison on Saturday, Nalini Sriharan, a convict in former PM Rajiv Gandhi's assassination case, said she felt "very sorry" when asked about her message for the Gandhis and families of those who were killed. "They have lost their dear ones. I hope they will come out of that tragedy once for all, any time," Nalini said.

308.title: Cong claims EVMs carried in private vehicles in Himachal's Rampur, urges ECI to take action
308.article_body: Congress has claimed that Electronic Voting Machines were carried in private vehicles in Rampur during the Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections. Calling it an "utterly unfortunate incident", Congress legal cell working chairman Pranay Pratap Singh asked the Chief Electoral Officer to "take cognisance in the said matter".  "The BJP party shall make a mockery out of elections," his complaint read.

309.title: Smuggler arrested in Noida with over 174 kg marijuana worth ₹50 lakh
309.article_body: The Gautam Buddha Nagar Police and UP Special Task Force arrested a man, Ajju, for allegedly smuggling over 174 kg of marijuana worth ₹50 lakh. "The suspect was carrying marijuana in his personal car, along with three other accomplices from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh…The vehicle used by the suspect for smuggling the drug has also been seized," said Noida's ADCP.

310.title: Actor-filmmaker Rakesh Kumar passes away aged 81 after battling cancer
310.article_body: Veteran actor and filmmaker Rakesh Kumar passed away on November 10 in Mumbai after a long battle with cancer. He was known for his work in films like Khoon Pasina, Do Aur Do Paanch, Mr Natwarlal and Yaarana among other films. Amitabh Bachchan condoled his demise and wrote, "Another colleague has left us and me in particular."

311.title: Jaishankar meets his Ukrainian counterpart, discusses nuclear concerns
311.article_body: India's External Affairs Minister Dr S Jaishankar met his Ukrainian counterpart Dmytro Kuleba in Cambodia on the sidelines of the ASEAN-India summit on Saturday. "Our discussions covered recent developments in the conflict, the grain initiative and nuclear concerns," Jaishankar tweeted. "I met to discuss bilateral cooperation and ways to end Russia's war on Ukraine," Kuleba said about the meeting.

312.title: Bajrang Dal activist killed in crude bomb attack in Jharkhand
312.article_body: A Bajrang Dal activist was killed after crude bombs were hurled at him by men on motorcycles in Jharkhand's West Singhbhum on Saturday, police said. The activist was taken to hospital where doctors declared that he was brought dead. Hundreds of the deceased's supporters gathered following the incident and the CRPF was called to maintain law and order, police added.

313.title: NHRC holds Delhi, Haryana, Punjab & UP governments responsible for stubble burning
313.article_body: The National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) on Saturday held the Delhi, Haryana, Punjab and Uttar Pradesh governments responsible for the continued stubble burning. The commission said that it is of the opinion that farmers are burning stubble "under compulsion". It also asked the state and Union Territory governments to submit affidavits on points raised by it within four days.

314.title: 'Stree 2' might be the next film, says director Amar Kaushik
314.article_body: Director Amar Kaushik said that the sequel of 'Stree' "might be" his next directorial film. "I'm aware that people will compare the sequel to the first part...yes, we have got an idea and 'Stree 2' might be the next film," he stated. Kaushik, who is currently promoting 'Bhediya', called Varun Dhawan the "most curious", "most enthusiastic" and "most passionate" actor.

315.title: ICC shares rankings of Pakistan, England players ahead of T20 World Cup 2022 final
315.article_body: Ahead of Pakistan-England T20 World Cup 2022 final, the ICC shared rankings of Pakistan and England players. England have more batters in top 100, while Pakistan's Muhammad Rizwan and Babar Azam are ranked second and fourth, respectively. Both Pakistan and England have three bowlers each in top 25, while Moeen Ali is top-ranked T20I all-rounder among the two teams.

316.title: Who will win 2022 T20 World Cup final? I'm going with Pakistan: Aakash
316.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has predicted Pakistan to win the 2022 T20 World Cup final against England on Sunday. "Who will win? I feel Pakistan will win...I don't think it will be a very high-scoring match," he said in a video posted on his YouTube channel. England reached the final after defeating India in the semi-final on Thursday.

317.title: What is the head-to-head record of Pakistan and England in T20I cricket?
317.article_body: England and Pakistan have played 28 matches against each other in T20Is. Pakistan have won nine times, while England have won 18 times including once in Super Over. One of their matches produced no result. Pakistan's highest total against England in 232/6 registered in 2021, while England's highest total against Pakistan is 221/3 recorded in September this year.

318.title: Man protests in Bengaluru after accident due to pothole, video surfaces
318.article_body: A video went viral on social media of a man seen protesting by sitting on the road in Bengaluru after falling from his scooter due to a pothole. He can be heard asking for a response from the BBMP officials. "Thanks to CV Raman Nagar MLA...for keeping Bengalurians [struggling] with their lives every day," read a Twitter post.

319.title: Flood alert for 5 Tamil Nadu districts, 4,230 cubic feet excess water discharged from dam
319.article_body: A flood alert has been issued for Theni, Dindigul, Madurai, Sivaganga and Ramanathapuram districts, news agency ANI reported. The dam officer said that 4,230 cubic feet of excess water has been discharged from Vaigai Dam in Theni. In October 2022, a flood alert was issued for 11 districts in the state.

320.title: Ganderbal DM bans use of electric heating appliances, later amends order
320.article_body: Amid the winter chill in J&K, the Ganderbal DM on Friday released an order banning the use of electric heating appliances. The order stated that the decision was taken to avoid unscheduled power cuts and provide a hassle-free electricity supply to consumers. After outrage, the order was amended to ban nichrome coil-based crude water heaters and crude cooking heaters.

321.title: We've got nothing to lose but everything to win: Akhtar on Pak-Eng T20 WC final
321.article_body: Ex-Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar, in a video posted on his social media, said they've got nothing to lose but everything to win in the 2022 T20 World Cup final against England. "Pakistan were nowhere and now [in the final]...our team is looking like a solid unit...we [only] need to play our A game," he added.

322.title: Anupam Kher fails to get Uunchai ticket as shows run housefull, shares video
322.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher shared a video of himself trying to buy a ticket for his movie 'Uunchai'. In the video, the man at the ticket counter can be seen telling him that there is no ticket available as the shows of the film are running housefull. "For the first time, saw success in failure," he wrote.

323.title: Former AIIMS Delhi director Randeep Guleria takes voluntary retirement
323.article_body: Randeep Guleria, former director of All India Institute of Medical Sciences in Delhi, has taken voluntary retirement. Reports said Guleria served the institute for over 30 years. His five-and-a-half-year tenure as the director of the institute ended on September 23. He applied for Voluntary Retirement Scheme. Guleria had joined AIIMS as an assistant professor in Department of Medicine in 1992.

324.title: Donald Trump's daughter Tiffany marries businessman Michael Boulos; pics surface
324.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump and his ex-wife Marla Maple's daughter Tiffany Trump and Michael Boulos got married in Mar-a-Lago on Saturday. Trump escorted his 29-year-old daughter down the aisle before she exchanged vows with the 25-year-old businessman. Melania, Ivanka, Eric, Donald Trump Jr were also present at the wedding.

325.title: Don't want people to gamble: Amit on refusing sports app endorsement
325.article_body: Actor Amit Sadh recently refused to endorse a sports app as he didn't want to promote something "that falls into grey areas". He said that even though he has huge respect for the game, he doesn't want people to gamble. "I don't wish to promote such things knowing how bad it can get. I would personally feel responsible," he shared.

326.title: 2-yr-old girl falls into open water tank at building, dies in Pune
326.article_body: A two-year-old girl died after she fell into an open water tank at an under-construction building in Pune. Following this, police booked the builder and contractor over their alleged negligence. The girl's father, who works as a labourer at the under-construction building, claimed in a complaint that the accused hadn't taken proper measures like covering the tank with a lid.

327.title: Blasting work at Navi Mumbai airport causing cracks in homes: Villagers
327.article_body: Blasting activity taking place during the construction of the Navi Mumbai International Airport has caused cracks to develop in houses, residents of the Wahal village have claimed. The village is located near the boundary of the airport. Earlier this month, the village sarpanch even wrote a letter to the City and Industrial Development Corporation of Maharashtra Limited over the matter.

328.title: ₹10,000 fine for mishap due to pet dog, cat in Noida; owner to pay medical expenses
328.article_body: Noida Authority has announced a fine of ₹10,000 in case of any mishap that takes place due to a pet dog or a pet cat. Besides that, the authority has said that medical expenses of the injured person or animal will be borne by the owner of the pet. Sterilization and anti-rabies vaccination of pet dogs has been made mandatory.

329.title: Was disrespected for my skin colour, slept without food: Mithun
329.article_body: Actor Mithun Chakraborty shared that he was "disrespected for a lot of years" because of his skin colour. He remembered that there were days when he'd sleep with an empty stomach. "I used to cry myself to sleep," the actor said. Mithun added he doesn't want a biopic on him because his story will discourage people from achieving their dreams.

330.title: How much prize money will T20 World Cup 2022 winners, runners-up get today?
330.article_body: The winners of the T20 World Cup 2022 final between Pakistan and England today will get a prize money of $1.6 million. Meanwhile, the runners-up will receive $800,000. Apart from the prize money for the final match, the two teams will also get bonus for their Super 12 victories. They will be getting $40,000 per Super 12 stage match victory.

331.title: Twitter Blue will probably 'come back by end of next week,' says Musk
331.article_body: Responding to a Twitter user asking when Twitter Blue will return, Elon Musk replied, "Probably end of next week." On Friday, Twitter paused its recently announced  $8 blue tick subscription amid an increase in fake accounts. Twitter introduced the "Official" label last Wednesday but a few hours later, Musk tweeted that he had "killed" it.

332.title: Election workers in Himachal Pradesh trek for 15 km in deep snow for 6 hours
332.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing polling agents trekking in deep snow in Himachal Pradesh after the Assembly elections concluded on Saturday. The video shows polling parties returning from Chasak Batori polling station, situated at an altitude of 12,000 ft, in Bharmour  Assembly Constituency in Chamba district. They walked around 15 km in snow for 6 hours.

333.title: Iranian man who inspired 2004 film 'The Terminal' dies at Paris airport
333.article_body: Merhan Karimi Nasseri, an Iranian man who lived at Paris' Charles de Gaulle Airport from 1988 until 2006 and inspired the 2004 Steven Spielberg directorial 'The Terminal', passed away at the airport after suffering a heart attack on Saturday. He died at the Terminal 2F of the airport, where he had been living again in recent weeks.

334.title: Unmanned, solar-powered US space plane returns to Earth after 908 days, pic surfaces
334.article_body: An unmanned US military space plane returned to Earth on Saturday after spending 908 days in orbit, surpassing its previous record of 780 days. The solar-powered X-37B shuttle has now spent a total of more than 10 years in space and flown more than 1.3 billion miles during six missions, Boeing said in a statement.

335.title: Democrats retain control of US Senate in mid-term elections
335.article_body: President Joe Biden's Democrats retained control of the US Senate on Saturday in the mid-term elections, US media reports claimed. Democratic US Senator Catherine Cortez Masto has won re-election in Nevada, bringing the total number of seats under Democrats' control to 50. The results have defied predictions of Republican control over both the houses of US Congress.

336.title: Two planes collide mid-air and crash at US air show, video surfaces
336.article_body: Two World War II-era planes collided at an airshow causing a huge fireball explosion to shoot up into the air. It happened at the Commemorative Air Force's Wings Over Dallas Show in Dallas, Texas. Video of the incident shows the two show planes colliding head on with onlookers screaming in background. It wasn't immediately clear how many people were aboard.

337.title: 3 of a family killed in accident on Delhi-Lucknow highway
337.article_body: Three members of a family were killed after their speeding car rammed into another vehicle on the Delhi-Lucknow National Highway on Saturday evening, police said. The driver of the car reportedly died on the spot while two people, including a woman, were rushed to a government hospital where they were declared brought dead. The accident occurred in UP's Amroha district.

338.title: 5 Afghan nationals found dead at a home in Turkey's capital
338.article_body: Five Afghan nationals with stab wounds were found dead in Turkey's capital Ankara, Khaama Press reported citing Turkish media on Saturday. Afghan officials in Turkey confirmed the death of five Afghans in a house in an area where Afghan and Syrian refugees live. Authorities reportedly started looking for them after receiving missing person complaints from their families.

339.title: Vice President Dhankhar discusses bilateral ties with Cambodian PM
339.article_body: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar met Cambodian Prime Minister Hun Sen in Phnom Penh on Saturday and discussed the enhancement of ties in de-mining, human resource and development projects. The leaders witnessed the exchange of four agreements between the two countries in streams of health, culture and wildlife. Dhankhar commended Sen for his country's successful chairmanship of the ASEAN Summit.

340.title: 21 killed as bus falls into canal in Egypt’s Nile Delta
340.article_body: At least 21 people were killed, including three children, after a bus fell into a canal in the Nile River Delta region of Egypt on Saturday. The accident occurred in Dakahlia province, around 100 km northeast of the capital of Cairo. A senior provincial police official said the bus driver seemed to have lost control of the steering wheel.

341.title: Things Cristiano has done this season are not acceptable: Rooney
341.article_body: Former Manchester United forward Wayne Rooney has criticised Cristiano Ronaldo and asked him to keep his "head down" and "be ready to play when the manager needs you". "If he does that, he will be an asset. If he doesn't, it will become an unwanted distraction," said Rooney. He added that "things" Cristiano has done this season are "not acceptable".

342.title: India's current golden chess generation will only get better: Anand
342.article_body: Indian chess grandmaster Viswanathan Anand said the country currently has a golden generation that will only get stronger as time progresses. "There is a wave...The internet has made chess more accessible to everyone," said Anand. He also named the teen trio of R Praggnanandhaa, Arjun Erigaisi and D Gukesh while talking about the next generation of Indian chess stars.

343.title: Terrorists shoot 2 labourers from Uttar Pradesh in J&K, 1 critical
343.article_body: Two residents of Uttar Pradesh, both of whom are labourers, were shot at by terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag on Saturday. The victims have been identified as Chota Prasad, a resident of Gorakhpur, and Govind, a resident of Kushinagar. Both of them were shifted to a hospital for treatment. One of them is in a critical condition.

344.title: Journalist asks Babar Azam question on IPL, he looks at Pakistan media manager
344.article_body: During the press conference ahead of T20 World Cup 2022 final between England and Pakistan, a journalist asked Babar Azam a question on IPL. Following the question, Babar looked at his media manager, refusing to answer the question. The media manager then responded, "We are taking questions on the World Cup final at the moment."

345.title: Rohit Sharma looked depressed during T20 World Cup: Shoaib Akhtar
345.article_body: Former Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar said that Indian skipper Rohit Sharma looked "depressed" and "off" during the T20 World Cup in Australia. "We all knew that Rohit wanted to be the skipper. But this is not an easy task to do. You have to live and breathe captaincy and also have to sacrifice family life," Akhtar said.

346.title: Under Matthew Hayden's guidance, Pak are a better unit: Brett Lee
346.article_body: Ex-Australian pacer Brett Lee said that under the guidance of his former teammate and Pakistan team's mentor, Matthew Hayden, the Babar Azam-led side is a better unit. "He's (Hayden) always been a leader. He's always been a person that speaks from the heart and a person that will call it out if it's not right...There's so much transparency," Lee said.

347.title: Nirmala Sitharaman should focus on economy, not Baramati: NCP
347.article_body: NCP commented on Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman amid reports of her planning to visit Baramati, which is represented by NCP leader Supriya Sule in the Lok Sabha, again. "Sitharaman is concentrating so much on 'B for Baramati' that she has forgotten 'E for [the] economy'," NCP spokesperson Clyde Crasto said. Notably, Sitharaman visited Baramati for three days in September 2022.

348.title: High command will soon decide on Raj leadership: Congress leader
348.article_body: Congress leader Acharya Pramod Krishnam said the party's high command would "very soon" take a decision on the leadership of Rajasthan. "The political scenario in Rajasthan is in the notice of the party high command," said Krishnam, adding that each and every MLA should abide by the high command's decision. Krishnam is reportedly close to former Deputy CM Sachin Pilot.

349.title: SC issues notice to govt over delay in appointment of judges
349.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) has issued a notice to the Ministry of Law and Justice and sought its response over the delay in appointing judges. The court noted 10 recommendations were pending for appointing a High Court judge. "Unless the bench is adorned by competent lawyers, the very concept of the Rule of Law and Justice suffers," the court said.

350.title: India announces additional $5 mn for ASEAN-India science fund
