350.article_body: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar on Saturday said India will make an additional contribution of $5 million to the ASEAN-India science and technology fund. The additional funding is expected to enhance cooperation in the sectors of renewable energy, public health and smart agriculture. The ASEAN-India Science and Technology Collaboration was formally launched in 1996.

351.title: Protesters clash with police in Bolivia; demand fresh census
351.article_body: Protesters clashed with police in Santa Cruz, Bolivia, on Friday amidst a general strike and weeks of unrest. The protesters demanded a fresh census be conducted to reflect the region's increased population and get increased funding from the government. Protesters clashed using molotov cocktails, stones and sticks. Images surfaced of a farmers' union bank being looted and being set ablaze.

352.title: FTA deal has had a flat tyre since I left office, let's get it done: Ex-UK PM Johnson
352.article_body: Former UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson called for finalising the free trade agreement (FTA) between India and UK which was targeted to be done by Diwali this year. "Let's finally deliver that free trade agreement which mysteriously seems to have developed a flat tyre since I left office," Johnson said. "I wonder what the hold-up is," he added.

353.title: Can't guarantee that I'll play another World Cup: Brazil's Neymar
353.article_body: Brazil forward Neymar said that the 2022 Qatar World Cup could be his last and he will "play it" like his last tournament. "I can't guarantee that I'll play another (World) Cup. I honestly don't know," said Neymar. The 30-year-old also said there would be a new coach for Brazil and he doesn't know if "that coach will like" him.

354.title: Actor Pawan Kalyan booked by police for sitting on roof of speeding car in Andhra
354.article_body: A case of rash driving was registered against Pawan Kalyan for a stunt, where he was seen sitting on the roof of a speeding car during his visit to a village in Andhra Pradesh. It was registered following a complaint by a motorist. The motorist apparently fell from his bike because of the driving of Pawan Kalyan's convoy of vehicles.

355.title: Blessings needed for fruitful results: Kejriwal on gods on notes appeal
355.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday said he had appealed to add the pictures of deities Lakshmi and Ganesh on currency notes as god's blessings are needed to reap fruitful results. He opined that people would receive blessings if notes carry pictures of gods. "Everything boils to Karma but results will be fruitful when Lord's blessings are there," he added.

356.title: Brentford's Toney scores 98th min goal to secure 2-1 win over Man City
356.article_body: Brentford striker Ivan Toney scored twice as his side won 2-1 against defending champions Manchester City in their final Premier League game before the World Cup break. "Obviously (being left out of the England squad was), a disappointment but...I'll just keep going," said Toney. After the match was tied 1-1, Toney scored in the 98th minute to secure victory.

357.title: Elon Musk to join G20 summit in Indonesia virtually: Report
357.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk will join the G20 summit in Indonesia's Bali virtually rather than in person, CNBC Indonesia reported. "He is unable to attend because...there are incidents in US and he must be present there," an official from the Indonesian Chamber of Commerce was quoted as saying. Musk is due to speak at a business-related event.

358.title: Punjab witnesses 2,467 stubble-burning incidents in a day
358.article_body: Punjab recorded 2,467 stubble-burning incidents on Saturday with Bathinda registering 358 farm fires, the maximum. With Saturday's cases, Punjab's tally of farm fires recorded between September 15 and November 12 rose to 43,144, as per the Punjab Remote Sensing Centre. Data suggests there has been a 27% drop in stubble-burning cases as compared to the corresponding period of last year.

359.title: Giriraj Sena chief Kamal Giri Dev assassinated in Jharkhand
359.article_body: Hindu organisation Giriraj Sena's chief Kamal Giri Dev was assassinated in Jharkhand's West Singhbhum district on Saturday. As per reports, Dev was standing with his friend at a chowk when three people approached him and attacked him with a bottle bomb. Thereafter, the attackers escaped from the spot. Dev was rushed to a nearby hospital, however, doctors declared him dead.

360.title: Pic of MS Dhoni with Amit Shah goes viral, people react
360.article_body: A picture of MS Dhoni meeting Home Minister Amit Shah has gone viral. The duo met at an event in Chennai, marking the 75th anniversary of India Cements. Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi also joined Dhoni and Shah at the event. "What's next? Dhoni joining BJP?" a fan wrote. "Chanakya of politics meets Chanakya of cricket," wrote another.

361.title: These 32 years were like hell: Rajiv Gandhi killing convict Nalini after release
361.article_body: One of the convicts of the Rajiv Gandhi assassination case, Nalini Sriharan, who was released from jail on Saturday, said, "It was a hellish experience in prison during these 32 years." She added, "My conviction that I am innocent has kept me alive all these years. Otherwise, I would've ended my life." She said she was 'framed' in the killing.

362.title: 1000 Congress leaders who voted for Tharoor will join BJP: Assam CM
362.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said he is expecting the 1,000 Congress delegates who voted for Shashi Tharoor as party President to join the BJP. "Result was known and declared even before counting of votes," said Sarma, adding that the delegates were the "only democratic people" in Congress. Mallikarjun Kharge was elected as Congress chief after polling nearly 8,000 votes.

363.title: Samantha Ruth Prabhu works out in gym with cannula in one arm, shares video
363.article_body: Samantha Ruth Prabhu shared a video in which she can be seen doing arm exercise with one hand while a cannula can be seen in her other arm. She also shared a picture with her fitness trainer. "Last few months you've been among the few people who has seen it all...through the weakness, through...tears, through...high dose steroid therapies," Samantha wrote.

364.title: Having a Canadian passport doesn't mean I'm any less of an Indian: Akshay Kumar
364.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar on Saturday said that his Canadian passport did not make him "any less of an Indian", adding, "I am very much Indian." He said this while responding to a query on the criticism over his Canadian citizenship. Kumar said he has remained in India despite getting the Canadian passport nine years ago.

365.title: Daughter of Naroda Patiya massacre convict gets BJP ticket in Guj
365.article_body: The BJP has given a ticket to the daughter of a 2002 Naroda Patiya massacre case convict for the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections. Manoj Kukrani's daughter, 30-year-old Payal Kukrani, is an anaesthetist and has been fielded from Naroda in Ahmedabad. She's among the youngest candidates fielded by the BJP in Gujarat this time. Manoj was earlier sentenced to life imprisonment.

366.title: Scarlett to return as Black Widow in 'Avengers: Secret Wars': Reports
366.article_body: Scarlett Johansson is reportedly returning to the Marvel Cinematic Universe. According to reports, the actress will reprise her role as Natasha Romanoff aka Black Widow in 'Avengers: Secret Wars', an upcoming film which is expected to release in 2026. The film will reportedly also feature Chris Hemsworth and Benedict Cumberbatch among others in pivotal roles.

367.title: Unfortunate & condemnable: Nitish on WB minister's comment on Prez Murmu
367.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Saturday criticised West Bengal minister Akhil Giri for his comments on President Droupadi Murmu, calling it "unfortunate and condemnable". "How can anyone make such comments on the President of India?" Kumar said, adding no one has the right to make such remarks. In a video, Akhil Giri was heard saying, "How does our President look?"

368.title: Eng beating Ind in T20 WC semifinal was spectacular: Ex-cricketer
368.article_body: After England defeated India by 10 wickets in the T20 World Cup semifinal on Thursday, ex-cricketer Kevin Pietersen said that the English team's "performance ranks right up there". "It was convincing as anything because that Indian team is star-studded. To beat them as convincingly as they did was spectacular. They didn't let India into the game at all," Pietersen said.

369.title: Rahul Gandhi may miss Parliament's winter session: Congress
369.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi is expected to miss the Parliament's upcoming winter session because of the ongoing Bharat Jodo Yatra, the party said on Saturday. The winter session is likely to start in December's first week and will conclude by the month's end. Other Congress leaders KC Venugopal and Digvijaya Singh are also expected to miss the session.

370.title: Farmers should get fertilisers easily, no shortage in state: MP CM
370.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Friday said that farmers of the state should get fertilisers easily. If the distribution system is lacking, it should be fixed, he said, adding that there's  no shortage of fertilisers in the state. His comment came after he held discussions with the collectors of districts facing problems with the distribution of fertilisers.

371.title: 147-member Pak delegation visits Hazrat Nizamuddin Dargah in Delhi
371.article_body: A 147-member religious delegation from Pakistan on Saturday visited the Hazrat Nizamuddin Aulia Dargah in New Delhi and offered a "chaddar" at the Sufi shrine, the Pakistani High Commission in India said in a tweet. The delegation, led by an official from Pakistan's Ministry of Religious Affairs and Interfaith Harmony, arrived in New Delhi from Islamabad on November 7.

372.title: I'm not stealing from anyone: Akshay on being trolled for doing too many films
372.article_body: Akshay Kumar, reacting to being trolled for doing 'too many films' in a year, said, "Who questions someone for working a lot?" "I do four films a year...I do ads...I work, but I'm not stealing from anyone," he said, adding, "I'll work, who won't if they've...chance to...work? I'll do four films...I'll give 50 days if required and...90 days if needed."

373.title: Ananya Panday shares childhood pic with Aryan Khan on his 25th b'day
373.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday took to her Instagram Stories on Saturday to wish Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan on his 25th birthday. She shared an unseen picture of them together from their childhood, and wrote, "Missing baby Aryan. Happy birthday to my first and forever best friend." Aryan's sister Suhana Khan also wished him on his birthday.

374.title: Shah urges TN govt to impart technical, medical education in Tamil
374.article_body: Union Minister Amit Shah on Saturday urged the Tamil Nadu government to impart technical and medical education in Tamil, saying it would be "a great service to the promotion of the language". He further said the move would help students understand lessons better. Students in several states are already reaping benefits from receiving higher education in regional languages, he added.

375.title: Ambedkar would be horrified by today's caste entrenchment: Tharoor
375.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor said there is greater consciousness of caste in Indian society today compared to the 1950s. "Ambedkar wanted to completely destroy the caste system and he [would] probably be horrified to realize that...(it) is more and more entrenched," said Tharoor. He added that parties against discrimination or untouchability nonetheless seek votes in the name of caste.

376.title: Mysuru to get 100-foot-tall statue of Tipu Sultan: Congress MLA
376.article_body: Karnataka Congress MLA Tanveer Sait said a 100-foot-tall statue of Tipu Sultan would be erected in Mysuru's Srirangapatna. "The BJP government has been distorting the history around Tipu Sultan," said Sait, adding that the statue will represent "actual history". Former CM Siddaramaiah backed the announcement and asked why a statue can't be built for the 18th-century warrior.

377.title: NCP leader Awhad gets bail in case for disrupting film screening
377.article_body: A local court in Thane on Saturday granted bail to Nationalist Congress Party leader Jitendra Awhad and 11 others in a case that alleges they disrupted the screening of the Marathi film 'Har Har Mahadev'. The former state minister and his supporters were arrested on Friday for disrupting the movie's screening at a mall in Thane city on November 7.

378.title: Aurobindo Pharma's Q2 net profit drops 41% to ₹409 cr
378.article_body: Aurobindo Pharma reported a 41% year-over-year decline in its consolidated net profit at ₹409 crore for the second quarter ended September. The drug firm's revenue also declined to ₹5,739 crore as against ₹5,942 crore in the year-ago period. Earlier on Thursday, the Enforcement Directorate arrested Aurobindo's Director Sarath Reddy for alleged involvement in the Delhi liquor policy scam.

379.title: 3 Bihar men held for making fake Patanjali websites, cheating people
379.article_body: Three people were arrested from Bihar for posing as representatives of Patanjali Yog Gram in Uttarakhand's Haridwar and cheating people seeking Ayurvedic treatment, police said on Saturday. Twenty fake websites that resembled the official Patanjali website were identified and their details were sent to the National Internet Exchange of India to get them blocked, according to police.

380.title: World's highest polling station sees 100% turnout: Himachal officer
380.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Chief Electoral Officer Mahesh Pathania said Tashigang, the world's highest polling station, saw 100% voter turnout on Saturday for state Assembly elections. This came despite temperature reaching minus 10°C in the area. Stalls with traditional food were installed at the booth. Situated at a height of 15,256 feet in Lahaul and Spiti district, Tashigang has 52 registered voters.

381.title: It will come very soon: Akshay Kumar on the status of his Indian passport
381.article_body: Akshay Kumar, while speaking at Hindustan Times Leadership Summit, shared an update regarding the status of his Indian passport. "Yes, I had said it in 2019, I applied for it. But then...pandemic happened...everything shut down for 2.5 years...Very soon my passport will come," he stated. Akshay added having a Canadian passport doesn't mean he's any less of an Indian.

382.title: I get 2-3 kgs 'gaali' daily, convert it into nutrition: PM in T'gana
382.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, while addressing BJP workers at the Begumpet Airport in Hyderabad on Saturday, said, "I get 2-3 kg of 'gaali' (abuse) every day...All such abuses in my stomach get converted into nutrition." "They (Opposition) have exhausted their dictionary of abuse...They do it because they have nothing else to offer," PM Modi added.

383.title: Farmer's house robbed at gunpoint in Nashik, valuables worth ₹8.50 lakh stolen
383.article_body: A group of five to six unidentified men allegedly entered a farmer's house and robbed his family at gunpoint in Maharashtra's Nashik district, police said on Saturday. The incident reportedly took place on the intervening night of Friday and Saturday. The accused escaped with 280 gm gold, 480 gm silver ornaments and cash, all worth ₹8.50 lakh, police added.

384.title: What will happen if T20 World Cup 2022 final gets washed out due to rain tomorrow?
384.article_body: Pakistan-England T20 World Cup 2022 final will take place on Sunday. There must be at least 10 overs bowled to side batting second (unless result is achieved sooner) for an official result. If rain doesn't allow the match to be completed on Sunday, it'll continue on Monday. Pakistan and England will be declared joint-winners if rain washes out reserve day.

385.title: Let's accept that we did not put up a good total: Sachin on India losing T20 WC 2022 semi
385.article_body: Referring to India's T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final defeat against England, Sachin Tendulkar said, "I know that the semi-final was really disappointing." Talking about India's total of 168, Sachin said, "Let's accept that we did not put up a good total on the board." He added India should have made around 190 given the dimensions of Adelaide.

386.title: Ukrainian police officers, broadcast services return to Kherson
386.article_body: Ukrainian police officers on Saturday returned to duty in Kherson following the withdrawal of Russian forces from the city, Ukraine's national police chief confirmed. Ukrainian TV and radio services have also reportedly resumed in the formerly Russian-occupied city. The Ukrainian military said it was overseeing "stabilization measures" in surrounding areas to make sure the city was safe.

387.title: Ranveer, Alia's 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' to release in April 2023
387.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar on Saturday announced the release date of his upcoming directorial 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani', a film which stars Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhatt in the lead roles. The film will arrive in theatres on April 28, 2023. 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' will also feature Jaya Bachchan, Shabana Azmi and Dharmendra.

388.title: SC verdict to release Rajiv Gandhi case convicts has hurt sentiments: Baghel
388.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM and Congress leader Bhupesh Baghel said that the release of six convicts by the Supreme Court in the former PM Rajiv Gandhi assassination case has hurt the sentiments of crores of people. "Congress national spokesperson Jairam Ramesh also gave a statement...it should not have happened," Baghel said. "The convicts were released before time," Baghel added.

389.title: Australian gets 129-yr jail term for raping kids including 18-month-old in Philippines
389.article_body: A man known as 'Australia's worst pedophile' has been sentenced to 129 years in jail in the Philippines for rape and sexual abuse of children including an 18-month-old baby. This was the second conviction of Peter Gerard Scully, who is already serving a life sentence for numerous offences including child pornography. Scully held and abused eight children in the Philippines.

390.title: Set up dengue hospital in each UP district: CM Yogi to officials
390.article_body: CM Yogi Adityanath held a high-level meeting to review the dengue situation in Uttar Pradesh and asked officials to set up a dedicated hospital in every district. He also directed all ministers to be on the field and said every patient should be given proper treatment. On Friday, the Allahabad HC pulled up the state government for the dengue menace.

391.title: Shweta Bachchan says her children make fun of her menopause
391.article_body: Shweta Bachchan opened up about going through menopause and said her children, Navya and Agastya Nanda, make jokes about it. "If I'm in...bad mood, and I shout at them, they'll say, 'Mom is menopausing today.' That's not fair...For you, it's a joke, but think about it for me, everything is going south," Shweta said in an episode of Navya's podcast.

392.title: Forex reserve is not a showpiece, but to use on rainy day: RBI Guv
392.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said that foreign exchange reserves have to be used to ensure there is no undue exchange rate volatility. "We didn't pick the reserves just to keep it as a showpiece. We picked it only for this rainy day," he added. "There were some observations made that RBI is using reserves indiscriminately. It's not so," Das said.

393.title: Will hire best lawyers to get Article 370 & 35A restored: Bukhari
393.article_body: J&K Apni Party President Altaf Bukhari said the organisation will hire the country's best lawyers to approach the Supreme Court for the restoration of Articles 370 and 35A. "Our state, as it existed on August 5, 2019, should be restored," said Bukhari. He added that his party will collect details of youths in J&K jails and seek their release.

394.title: Sexual assault cases to be reviewed within 1 month: Uttarakhand CM
394.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami on Saturday stated that complaints of sexual assault and domestic violence against women in the state would be examined within one month. He claimed action will be taken against government officials who don't work on such issues. Further, he launched a self-registration option on Uttarakhand Police App for women working in government and non-government offices.

395.title: Delhivery's Q2 revenue rises 20% YoY to ₹1,796 cr, net loss narrows 60%
395.article_body: Logistics company Delhivery's consolidated revenue in July-September quarter grew around 20% year-over-year to ₹1,796 crore as against ₹1,497.7 crore from the year-ago period. Delhivery's net loss in the second quarter narrowed 60% to ₹254.1 crore against the loss of ₹635 crore reported in the same period last year. The revenue from express parcel services grew 17% year-over-year to ₹1,125 crore.

396.title: Ex-guard at UK's Berlin embassy pleads guilty to spying for Russia
396.article_body: A former security guard at the British embassy in Berlin has pleaded guilty to spying for Russia and faces a maximum prison sentence of 14 years. David Ballantyne Smith provided confidential information about British civil servants to Russia's military attache in Berlin, British prosecutors said. They claim Smith was angry over the embassy's show of support for the LGBTQ+ community.

397.title: Himachal records 65.92% voter turnout till 5 pm: Election Commission
397.article_body: Himachal Pradesh recorded a voter turnout of 65.92% till 5 pm on Saturday, according to the Election Commission of India. Shillai recorded the highest turnout at 77%, while Sarkaghat recorded the lowest 55.40% among the 68 Assembly constituencies in the state, the poll panel added. "Elections were peaceful in all the segments," state Office of CEO's Joint Director Media said.

398.title: List of most polluted Indian cities today released
398.article_body: The Central Pollution Control Board released the city-wise air quality index (AQI) on Saturday, with Bihar's Motihari, Siwan and Darbhanga having the highest AQI at 419, 417 and 404, respectively. This is followed by Bettiah (394), Katihar (385), Purnia (379), Saharsa (372), Begusarai (370), Chhapra (368), Samastipur (348), Bhagalpur (325), Araria (316) and Bihar Sharif (314).

399.title: Buttler, Babar pose with T20 WC 2022 trophy on roof of MCG, ICC shares pics
399.article_body: England captain Jos Buttler and Pakistan captain Babar Azam posed with T20 World Cup 2022 trophy on roof of the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG) ahead of the final. The ICC shared pictures on Instagram, writing, "Pakistan and England have scaled the heights to reach the final...Who will come out on top at the MCG?" The final will take place tomorrow.

400.title: Jos Buttler, Babar Azam pick their Player of T20 World Cup 2022
400.article_body: England captain Jos Buttler and Pakistan captain Babar Azam, whose teams will face each other in T20 World Cup 2022 final, have picked their Player of the Tournament. Buttler chose Suryakumar Yadav, saying, "He's been incredibly eye-catching to watch in such a star-studded line-up. To stand out the way he has is amazing." Meanwhile, Babar chose his compatriot Shadab Khan.

401.title: Pay attention to PM Modi's empty promises made during Hyd speech: TRS MLC
401.article_body: TRS MLC K Kavitha urged the people of the state to pay attention to the empty promises made by PM Narendra Modi during his speech in Hyderabad on Saturday. She claimed that PM Modi had once again failed to explain the role the BJP-led Centre had played in Telangana's development. "People need to be aware of...BJP's dishonest strategies," she added.

402.title: Akshay confirms his exit from Hera Pheri 3, says 'Wasn't satisfied with script'
402.article_body: Akshay Kumar has confirmed that he's not a part of 'Hera Pheri 3'. "I wasn't satisfied with the script. I have to do what people want to see. That is why I backed out," he said. Paresh Rawal recently confirmed that Kartik Aaryan has been roped in for the third instalment. Reportedly, Kartik will play the role of Raju now.

403.title: BJP govt delaying J&K Assembly polls to continue proxy rule: AAP leader
403.article_body: AAP leader Harsh Dev Singh on Saturday claimed that BJP-led government was delaying the Assembly elections in Jammu and Kashmir to deny people their democratic rights and to continue its proxy rule. The silence of the Centre and Election Commission on Jammu and Kashmir while announcing elections for Himachal Pradesh and Gujarat amply revealed the government's intention, Singh said.

404.title: Will provide 500 units of free electricity if elected: J&K Apni Party
404.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Apni Party President Altaf Bukhari on Saturday said his party will give 500 units of free electricity in Jammu in summer and Kashmir in winter if elected to power. Addressing a public rally at Sher-i-Kashmir Cricket Stadium in Srinagar, Bukhari said, "The day Apni Party will form its government, we'll provide employment to youth of Kashmir."

405.title: US seeks 15 years in prison for Theranos Founder Elizabeth Holmes
405.article_body: US Department of Justice recommended Theranos Founder Elizabeth Holmes should spend 15 years in prison and pay $800 million. Holmes was found guilty on four counts of wire fraud and conspiracy related to her now-defunct blood-testing startup. She faces up to 20 years in prison for each count. Earlier, Holmes urged a California judge to not send her to prison.

406.title: 4 dead bodies found in German town; murder-suicide suspected
406.article_body: Four dead bodies were recovered from three separate locations in Germany's Weilheim town on Friday, including the body of a 59-year-old man who is believed to have killed the other three individuals, according to police. Police found the bodies of two of the victims while searching the man's house. Investigators believe the suspect inflicted fatal injuries on himself, police informed.

407.title: Tremors felt across Delhi, other areas as 5.4 magnitude quake hits Nepal; 2nd in a week
407.article_body: Tremors were felt across Delhi and its neighbouring areas on Saturday as a 5.4 magnitude earthquake hit Nepal. This is the second time that tremors have been felt this week. Previously, strong tremors were felt in Delhi-NCR and several other parts of North India on Wednesday as a 6.3-magnitude earthquake had hit Nepal at around 2 am.
